definition.en: To perform a role or take action; a deed or a performance.

morphology_note.en: From Latin agere/actum ("to do, drive"). The base root meaning "to do".
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 agere/actum（做、驱动）。词根本义为"做"。

definition.en: A person who performs in plays, films, or television.

morphology_note.en: act ("do, perform") + -or (agent suffix) → one who performs.
morphology_note.zh: act（做、表演）+ -or（施事者后缀）→ 表演的人，即演员。

definition.en: The process of doing something; a thing done.

morphology_note.en: act ("do") + -ion (noun suffix) → the process of doing.
morphology_note.zh: act（做）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 做的过程，即行动。

definition.en: Engaged in activity; energetic or lively.

morphology_note.en: act ("do") + -ive (adjective suffix) → inclined to do, energetic.
morphology_note.zh: act（做）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于做的，即积极的。

definition.en: The state of being active; a specific pursuit or pastime.

morphology_note.en: act ("do") + -iv- (adjective) + -ity (noun suffix) → the state of doing, an activity.
morphology_note.zh: act（做）+ -iv-（形容词）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 做的状态，即活动。

definition.en: A person who campaigns vigorously for social or political change.

morphology_note.en: act ("do") + -iv- (adjective) + -ist (person) → a person who actively does things for a cause.
morphology_note.zh: act（做）+ -iv-（形容词）+ -ist（人）→ 积极做事的人，即活动家。

definition.en: To make something active or operative; to trigger.

morphology_note.en: act ("do") + -iv- (adjective) + -ate (verb suffix) → to make active.
morphology_note.zh: act（做）+ -iv-（形容词）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使变得活跃，即激活。

definition.en: To make into law; to act out or perform.

morphology_note.en: en- ("make, put into") + act ("do") → to put into action, especially as law.
morphology_note.zh: en-（使、置于）+ act（做）→ 付诸行动，尤其指立法。

definition.en: To communicate or act upon each other reciprocally.

morphology_note.en: inter- ("between, among") + act ("do") → to do things between each other.
morphology_note.zh: inter-（在……之间）+ act（做）→ 相互之间做事，即互动。

definition.en: Abnormally or excessively active.

morphology_note.en: hyper- ("over, excessive") + act ("do") + -ive (adjective) → excessively active.
morphology_note.zh: hyper-（过度）+ act（做）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 过度活跃的。

definition.en: Belonging to a foreign country or civilization; a foreigner or extraterrestrial being.

morphology_note.en: ali ("other") + -en (adjective suffix) → of another kind, foreign.
morphology_note.zh: ali（其他的）+ -en（形容词后缀）→ 另一种的，即外来的。

definition.en: To cause someone to feel isolated or estranged.

morphology_note.en: ali ("other") + -en- + -ate (verb suffix) → to make someone feel like an other.
morphology_note.zh: ali（其他的）+ -en- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 使某人成为"他者"，即疏远。

definition.en: The state of being isolated or estranged from a group or activity.

morphology_note.en: ali ("other") + -en- + -ation (noun suffix) → the process of becoming other, estrangement.
morphology_note.zh: ali（其他的）+ -en- + -ation（名词后缀）→ 变成"他者"的过程，即异化。

definition.en: Unable to be taken away or transferred to another; inherent.
definition.zh: 不可剥夺的；不可分割的

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + ali ("other") + -en- + -able ("can be") → cannot be made another's, inalienable.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ ali（其他的）+ -en- + -able（能够）→ 不能转让给他人的，即不可剥夺的。

definition.en: To change or modify something.

morphology_note.en: From Latin alter ("other"). To make other, i.e. to change.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 alter（另一个）。使之成为另一个，即改变。

definition.en: To occur in turns; every other one in a series.

morphology_note.en: alter ("other") + -n- + -ate (verb suffix) → to change to the other, take turns.
morphology_note.zh: alter（另一个）+ -n- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 转换到另一个，即轮流。

definition.en: Available as another choice; one of two or more possibilities.
definition.zh: 可替代的；备选的；替代方案

morphology_note.en: alter ("other") + -n- + -ative (adjective suffix) → offering another option.
morphology_note.zh: alter（另一个）+ -n- + -ative（形容词后缀）→ 提供另一种选择的。

definition.en: Selfless concern for the well-being of others.

morphology_note.en: altru- (from Latin alter, "other") + -ism (doctrine) → the principle of caring for others.
morphology_note.zh: altru-（源自拉丁语 alter，另一个）+ -ism（主义）→ 关心他人的原则。

definition.en: A false or assumed name.

morphology_note.en: ali ("other") + -as (Latin ending) → "otherwise called", another name.
morphology_note.zh: ali（其他的）+ -as（拉丁语词尾）→ "另外被称为"，即别名。

definition.en: A claim of having been elsewhere when a crime was committed; an excuse.

morphology_note.en: ali ("other") + -bi ("place", from Latin) → "in another place", an alibi.
morphology_note.zh: ali（其他的）+ -bi（地方，源自拉丁语）→ "在另一个地方"，即不在场证明。

definition.en: An abnormal immune reaction to a typically harmless substance.

morphology_note.en: all- (from Greek allos, "other") + erg ("work, reaction") + -y (noun) → an "other" reaction by the body.
morphology_note.zh: all-（源自希腊语 allos，其他的）+ erg（反应）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 身体的"异常"反应。

definition.en: A person or nation united with another for a common purpose; to combine resources.

morphology_note.en: al- (from Latin ad-, "to") + -ly (from ligare via ali, "bind to another") → to bind together, an ally.
morphology_note.zh: al-（源自拉丁语 ad-，向）+ -ly（源自 ligare 经 ali，绑向他人）→ 联合在一起，即盟友。

definition.en: A union or association formed for mutual benefit.

morphology_note.en: al- ("to") + li (from ali, "other/bind") + -ance (noun suffix) → a binding together, alliance.
morphology_note.zh: al-（向）+ li（源自 ali，他者/联结）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 联结在一起，即联盟。

definition.en: A love affair, especially a secret one.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -our (noun suffix from French) → a love affair.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -our（法语名词后缀）→ 恋爱关系。

definition.en: A person who does something for enjoyment rather than as a profession.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -ateur (French agent suffix) → one who does something out of love, not profession.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -ateur（法语施事者后缀）→ 出于热爱做某事的人，即业余爱好者。

definition.en: A person who is hostile to or opposes another; an adversary.

morphology_note.en: en- (from Latin in-, "not") + em (variant of am, "love") + -y → one who is not loved, an enemy.
morphology_note.zh: en-（源自拉丁语 in-，不）+ em（am 的变体，爱）+ -y → 不被爱的人，即敌人。

definition.en: A state of deep-seated hostility or hatred.

morphology_note.en: en- ("not") + em (variant of am, "love") + -ity (noun suffix) → the state of not loving, hostility.
morphology_note.zh: en-（不）+ em（am 的变体，爱）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 不爱的状态，即敌意。

definition.en: Hostile; tending to obstruct or harm.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + im (variant of am, "love") + -ical (adjective) → not loving, hostile.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ im（am 的变体，爱）+ -ical（形容词后缀）→ 不友爱的，即有敌意的。

definition.en: To fill with love or fascination; to charm.

morphology_note.en: en- ("cause to be in") + am ("love") + -or → to cause to be in love.
morphology_note.zh: en-（使处于）+ am（爱）+ -or → 使处于恋爱中，即使迷恋。

definition.en: Showing or feeling romantic love or desire.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -or- + -ous (adjective suffix) → full of love, amorous.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -or- + -ous（形容词后缀）→ 充满爱的，即多情的。

definition.en: Friendly and pleasant in manner; likeable.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -i- + -able ("worthy of") → worthy of love, friendly.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -i- + -able（值得……的）→ 值得爱的，即和蔼可亲的。

definition.en: Friendly and peaceful relations between people or nations.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -ity (noun suffix) → a state of love/friendliness.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 爱/友善的状态，即友好。

definition.en: Relating to or expressing romantic love.

morphology_note.en: am ("love") + -atory (adjective suffix) → relating to love.
morphology_note.zh: am（爱）+ -atory（形容词后缀）→ 与爱情相关的。

definition.en: A living organism that feeds on organic matter and has specialized sense organs.

morphology_note.en: anim ("breath, spirit, life") + -al (noun/adjective suffix) → a being with breath/life.
morphology_note.zh: anim（呼吸、精神、生命）+ -al（名词/形容词后缀）→ 有呼吸/生命的存在，即动物。

definition.en: To bring to life or give spirit to; alive or having life.
definition.zh: 使有生气；使活泼；赋予生命

morphology_note.en: anim ("breath, spirit") + -ate (verb suffix) → to give breath/spirit to, to enliven.
morphology_note.zh: anim（呼吸、精神）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 赋予呼吸/精神，即使活跃。

definition.en: Full of life or excitement; made using animation techniques.

morphology_note.en: anim ("spirit") + -ated (past participle as adjective) → given spirit, lively.
morphology_note.zh: anim（精神）+ -ated（过去分词作形容词）→ 被赋予精神的，即生动的。

definition.en: The state of being lively; the technique of making films with drawings or models.

morphology_note.en: anim ("spirit, life") + -ation (noun suffix) → the act of giving life, animation.
morphology_note.zh: anim（精神、生命）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 赋予生命的行为，即动画。

definition.en: Not alive; showing no sign of life.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + anim ("spirit, life") + -ate (adjective) → without life or spirit.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ anim（精神、生命）+ -ate（形容词后缀）→ 没有生命的。

definition.en: To restore to life or consciousness; to revive.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + anim ("spirit, life") + -ate (verb) → to give life again, revive.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ anim（精神、生命）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 再次赋予生命，即复活。

definition.en: Strong hostility or ill feeling toward someone.

morphology_note.en: anim ("spirit, feeling") + -os- + -ity (noun suffix) → a spirited feeling, typically hostile.
morphology_note.zh: anim（精神、感情）+ -os- + -ity（名词后缀）→ 激烈的情感，即仇恨。

definition.en: Generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person.

morphology_note.en: magn ("great") + anim ("spirit") + -ous (adjective) → having a great spirit, generous.
morphology_note.zh: magn（大）+ anim（精神）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 精神伟大的，即宽宏大量的。

definition.en: Mental calmness and composure, especially in a difficult situation.

morphology_note.en: equ ("equal") + anim ("spirit, mind") + -ity (noun) → an even spirit, composure.
morphology_note.zh: equ（平等）+ anim（精神、心灵）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 平和的心境，即沉着。

definition.en: In a manner that is appropriate or fitting.

morphology_note.en: apt ("fitting") + -ly (adverb suffix) → in a fitting manner.
morphology_note.zh: apt（适合的）+ -ly（副词后缀）→ 以适合的方式。

definition.en: Not suitable or appropriate in the circumstances.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + apt ("fitting") → not fitting, inappropriate.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ apt（适合的）→ 不适合的，即不恰当的。

definition.en: A natural ability or talent for something.

morphology_note.en: apt ("fitting, suited") + -itude (noun suffix for quality) → the quality of being naturally suited.
morphology_note.zh: apt（适合的）+ -itude（表示性质的名词后缀）→ 天然适合的品质，即天赋。

definition.en: Having or showing no skill; clumsy or incompetent.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + ept (variant of apt, "fitting") → not fitting, clumsy.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ ept（apt 的变体，适合的）→ 不适合的，即笨拙的。

definition.en: Lack of skill or ability; incompetence.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + ept (variant of apt, "fitting") + -itude (noun) → the quality of not being fit, incompetence.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ ept（apt 的变体，适合的）+ -itude（名词后缀）→ 不适合的品质，即无能。

definition.en: A luminous point in the night sky; a famous or talented person.

morphology_note.en: From the root aster/star ("star"), via Germanic. The core meaning is a celestial body.
morphology_note.zh: 源自词根 aster/star（星），经日耳曼语演变。核心含义为天体。

definition.en: A sudden event causing great damage or suffering; a catastrophe.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("bad, away") + aster ("star") → an ill-starred event, a calamity.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（坏的、偏离）+ aster（星）→ 星象不利的事件，即灾难。

definition.en: Causing great damage or suffering; catastrophic.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("bad") + aster ("star") + -ous (adjective) → ill-starred, catastrophic.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（坏的）+ aster（星）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 星象不好的，即灾难性的。

definition.en: An event causing sudden great damage or suffering; a major disaster.

morphology_note.en: cata- ("down") + strophe (related to aster, "star/turning") → a turning downward, a sudden calamity.
morphology_note.zh: cata-（向下）+ strophe（与 aster 相关，星/转向）→ 急转直下，即大灾难。

definition.en: The branch of science that deals with celestial objects and phenomena.

morphology_note.en: astro ("star") + nom ("law, arrangement") + -y (noun) → the study of the laws of the stars.
morphology_note.zh: astro（星）+ nom（法则、排列）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 研究星体规律的学科。

definition.en: A person trained to travel and work in outer space.

morphology_note.en: astro ("star") + naut ("sailor") → a star sailor, one who travels among the stars.
morphology_note.zh: astro（星）+ naut（航行者）→ 星际航行者，即宇航员。

definition.en: The study of the supposed influence of celestial bodies on human affairs.

morphology_note.en: astro ("star") + -logy ("study of") → the study of the stars' influence.
morphology_note.zh: astro（星）+ -logy（学科）→ 研究星辰影响的学问，即占星学。

definition.en: A small rocky body orbiting the sun, mainly found between Mars and Jupiter.

morphology_note.en: aster ("star") + -oid ("resembling") → star-like, a small star-like body.
morphology_note.zh: aster（星）+ -oid（类似的）→ 类似星星的，即小行星。

definition.en: A star-shaped symbol (*) used in printing and writing as a reference mark.

morphology_note.en: aster ("star") + -isk (diminutive suffix) → a little star, the star-shaped symbol.
morphology_note.zh: aster（星）+ -isk（小词后缀）→ 小星星，即星号。

definition.en: Relating to astronomy; extremely large in amount.

morphology_note.en: astro ("star") + nom ("law") + -ical (adjective) → relating to the laws of the stars; figuratively, immensely large.
morphology_note.zh: astro（星）+ nom（法则）+ -ical（形容词后缀）→ 关于星体法则的；引申为极其巨大的。

definition.en: A fence or obstacle that prevents movement or access.

morphology_note.en: bar ("bar, rod, obstacle") + -ier (noun suffix) → something that bars the way.
morphology_note.zh: bar（栏、杆、障碍）+ -ier（名词后缀）→ 阻挡道路的东西，即屏障。

definition.en: An improvised barrier erected to block a passage; to block with a barricade.

morphology_note.en: bar ("bar, obstacle") + -ric- + -ade (noun suffix) → a structure that bars passage.
morphology_note.zh: bar（栏、障碍）+ -ric- + -ade（名词后缀）→ 阻拦通行的结构，即路障。

definition.en: To cause someone to feel awkward, self-conscious, or ashamed.

morphology_note.en: em- ("in") + bar ("bar, obstacle") + -ass → to put in an obstacle, to impede or fluster.
morphology_note.zh: em-（进入）+ bar（栏、障碍）+ -ass → 置入障碍中，即使困窘。

definition.en: A feeling of self-consciousness or shame; a cause of such feeling.

morphology_note.en: embarrass + -ment (noun suffix) → the state of being embarrassed.
morphology_note.zh: embarrass（使尴尬）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 尴尬的状态。

definition.en: To send someone away from a place as an official punishment; to get rid of.

morphology_note.en: ban (from bar, "to bar/prohibit") + -ish (verb suffix) → to officially bar someone from a place.
morphology_note.zh: ban（源自 bar，禁止）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 正式禁止某人进入某地，即放逐。

definition.en: To give up completely; to desert or leave behind.

morphology_note.en: a- ("to") + ban (from bar, "control, jurisdiction") + -don → to put out of one's control, to give up.
morphology_note.zh: a-（向）+ ban（源自 bar，控制、管辖）+ -don → 脱离控制，即放弃。

definition.en: An even distribution of weight; a state of equilibrium.

morphology_note.en: bal- (from bar, via Latin bilanx, "having two pans/bars") + -ance (noun) → a state of equal bars, equilibrium.
morphology_note.zh: bal-（源自 bar，经拉丁语 bilanx，两个盘/杆）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 两杆平衡的状态。

definition.en: An elaborate and formal meal for many people.

morphology_note.en: From banc/bar ("bench, table") + -et (diminutive) → originally a small bench gathering, now a feast.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 banc/bar（长凳、桌子）+ -et（小词后缀）→ 原指小型聚餐，后演变为宴会。

definition.en: A financial institution; the land alongside a river.

morphology_note.en: From banc/bar ("bench, counter") → the money-changer's bench, hence a bank.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 banc/bar（长凳、柜台）→ 兑换商的柜台，后引申为银行。

definition.en: Savagely cruel; exceedingly brutal or primitive.

morphology_note.en: bar-bar (onomatopoeia for foreign speech, "bar-bar") + -ic (adjective) → sounding foreign, hence uncivilized.
morphology_note.zh: bar-bar（模拟外族人说话的拟声词）+ -ic（形容词后缀）→ 听起来像外族人的，即野蛮的。

definition.en: Goods that have been imported or exported illegally.

morphology_note.en: contra- ("against") + ban (from bar, "ban, prohibition") → goods against the ban, smuggled items.
morphology_note.zh: contra-（违反）+ ban（源自 bar，禁令）→ 违反禁令的货物，即走私品。

definition.en: The scientific study of living organisms and life processes.
definition.zh: 研究生物体及其生命过程的科学。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + -logy ("study of") -> the study of life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ -logy（学科）→ 研究生命的学科。

definition.en: A scientist who specializes in the study of living organisms.
definition.zh: 专门研究生物体的科学家。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + log ("study") + -ist ("person") -> a person who studies life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ log（研究）+ -ist（从事者）→ 研究生命的人。

definition.en: Relating to the processes or characteristics of living organisms.
definition.zh: 与生物体过程或特征相关。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + log ("study") + -ical (adjectival) -> pertaining to the study of life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ log（研究）+ -ical（形容词后缀）→ 关于生命研究的。

definition.en: A written record that tells the life story of a person.
definition.zh: 描述某人一生的文字记录。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + graph ("write") + -y (noun) -> a writing of someone’s life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ graph（书写）+ -y（名词）→ 对生命经历的书写。

definition.en: A biography written by the person it is about.
definition.zh: 由当事人亲自撰写的传记。

morphology_note.en: auto ("self") + bio ("life") + graph ("write") -> one’s self-written life story.
morphology_note.zh: auto（自我）+ bio（生命）+ graph（书写）→ 自己写的生命故事。

definition.en: The global ecological system integrating all living beings and their environments.
definition.zh: 整合所有生物及其环境的全球生态系统。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + sphere ("ball, globe") -> the sphere where life exists.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ sphere（球体）→ 存在生命的球层。

definition.en: The variety of species and ecosystems that make up life on Earth.
definition.zh: 构成地球生命体系的物种与生态系统多样性。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + diversity ("variety") -> the variety found within life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ diversity（多样）→ 生命内部的多样性。

definition.en: The use of living systems to create products or solve practical problems.
definition.zh: 利用生物系统生产产品或解决实际问题的技术。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + techno ("craft, skill") + -logy ("study") -> applying knowledge of life through technology.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ techno（技艺）+ -logy（学科）→ 将生命知识用于技术。

definition.en: The branch of science that explores the chemistry of living organisms.
definition.zh: 研究生命化学过程的科学。

morphology_note.en: bio ("life") + chemistry -> the chemistry underlying life.
morphology_note.zh: bio（生命）+ chemistry（化学）→ 生命背后的化学。

definition.en: The study of microscopic organisms such as bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
definition.zh: 研究细菌、病毒、真菌等微生物的学科。

morphology_note.en: micro ("small") + bio ("life") + -logy ("study") -> the study of small life forms.
morphology_note.zh: micro（微小）+ bio（生命）+ -logy（学科）→ 研究微小生命体的学科。

definition.en: A close biological interaction between organisms of different species.
definition.zh: 不同物种间紧密的生物互作关系。

morphology_note.en: sym- ("together") + bio ("life") + -sis ("state") -> a state of living together.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（共同）+ bio（生命）+ -sis（状态）→ 共同生活的状态。

definition.en: The scientific study of plants.

morphology_note.en: bot (from Greek botane, "plant, herb") + -an- + -y (noun suffix) → the study of plants.
morphology_note.zh: bot（源自希腊语 botane，植物、草本）+ -an- + -y（名词后缀）→ 研究植物的学科。

definition.en: A scientist who specializes in the study of plants.

morphology_note.en: bot ("plant") + -an- + -ist (person suffix) → a person who studies plants.
morphology_note.zh: bot（植物）+ -an- + -ist（人物后缀）→ 研究植物的人。

definition.en: Relating to plants or botany.

morphology_note.en: bot ("plant") + -an- + -ic (adjective suffix) → relating to plants.
morphology_note.zh: bot（植物）+ -an- + -ic（形容词后缀）→ 与植物有关的。

definition.en: Of or relating to plants or the study of plants.

morphology_note.en: bot ("plant") + -an- + -ical (adjective suffix) → pertaining to the study of plants.
morphology_note.zh: bot（植物）+ -an- + -ical（形容词后缀）→ 与植物学相关的。

definition.en: A cylinder of wax with a central wick that is lit to produce light.

morphology_note.en: cand ("glow, shine, white") + -le (noun suffix) → a glowing object, a candle.
morphology_note.zh: cand（发光、闪耀、白色）+ -le（名词后缀）→ 发光的物体，即蜡烛。

definition.en: Truthful and straightforward; frank.

morphology_note.en: cand ("white, bright") + -id (adjective suffix) → bright and clear, hence honest and frank.
morphology_note.zh: cand（白色、明亮）+ -id（形容词后缀）→ 光明磊落的，即坦白的。

definition.en: The quality of being open, honest, and direct.

morphology_note.en: cand ("white, bright") + -or (noun suffix) → brightness of character, openness.
morphology_note.zh: cand（白色、明亮）+ -or（名词后缀）→ 品性的光明，即坦率。

definition.en: A person who applies for a job or is nominated for an election.

morphology_note.en: cand ("white, bright") + -id- + -ate (noun suffix) → one dressed in white (Roman candidates wore white togas), a candidate.
morphology_note.zh: cand（白色、明亮）+ -id- + -ate（名词后缀）→ 穿白衣的人（古罗马候选人穿白色托加），即候选人。

definition.en: The fact or condition of being a candidate.
definition.zh: 候选资格；候选人的身份

morphology_note.en: cand ("white") + -id- + -acy (state/condition suffix) → the state of being a candidate.
morphology_note.zh: cand（白色）+ -id- + -acy（状态后缀）→ 候选人的状态，即候选资格。

definition.en: An action or event regarded as morally wrong and causing public outrage.

morphology_note.en: s- (from Greek skandalon) + cand ("shine/expose") + -al → something brought to light that causes disgrace.
morphology_note.zh: s-（源自希腊语 skandalon）+ cand（照亮/暴露）+ -al → 被曝光的令人蒙羞之事。

definition.en: Causing general public outrage by perceived moral wrongdoing.
definition.zh: 丑闻的；可耻的；令人愤慨的

morphology_note.en: scandal + -ous (adjective suffix) → causing or involving scandal.
morphology_note.zh: scandal（丑闻）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 引起丑闻的。

definition.en: Having the ability or quality necessary to do something.

morphology_note.en: cap ("take, seize, hold") + -able ("able to") → able to take hold, competent.
morphology_note.zh: cap（抓住、容纳）+ -able（能够）→ 能够掌握的，即有能力的。

definition.en: The maximum amount that something can contain; the ability to do something.

morphology_note.en: cap ("take, hold") + -ac- + -ity (noun suffix) → the ability to hold or contain.
morphology_note.zh: cap（抓住、容纳）+ -ac- + -ity（名词后缀）→ 容纳的能力，即容量。

definition.en: To take into one's possession by force; the act of capturing.

morphology_note.en: cap ("take, seize") + -ture (noun/verb suffix) → the act of taking or seizing.
morphology_note.zh: cap（抓住、夺取）+ -ture（名词/动词后缀）→ 抓住的行为，即捕获。

definition.en: A person who has been taken prisoner; held in confinement.

morphology_note.en: cap ("take, seize") + -t- + -ive (adjective/noun) → one who has been taken, a prisoner.
morphology_note.zh: cap（抓住、夺取）+ -t- + -ive（形容词/名词后缀）→ 被抓住的人，即俘虏。

definition.en: To attract and hold the attention or interest of someone; to charm.

morphology_note.en: cap ("take, seize") + -t- + -iv- + -ate (verb) → to take hold of someone's attention.
morphology_note.zh: cap（抓住）+ -t- + -iv- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 抓住某人的注意力，即迷住。

definition.en: To consent to receive or undertake something.

morphology_note.en: ac- (from ad-, "to") + cept (variant of cap, "take") → to take toward oneself, to accept.
morphology_note.zh: ac-（源自 ad-，向）+ cept（cap 的变体，拿）→ 拿向自己，即接受。

definition.en: An abstract idea or a general notion.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + cept (variant of cap, "take") → something taken together in the mind, an idea.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ cept（cap 的变体，拿）→ 在心中综合起来的东西，即概念。

definition.en: To become aware of something through the senses; to understand or interpret.

morphology_note.en: per- ("thoroughly") + ceive (variant of cap, "take") → to take in thoroughly, to perceive.
morphology_note.zh: per-（彻底地）+ ceive（cap 的变体，拿）→ 彻底接收，即感知。

definition.en: To be given, presented with, or paid something.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + ceive (variant of cap, "take") → to take back, to receive.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ ceive（cap 的变体，拿）→ 拿回来，即接收。

definition.en: To deliberately cause someone to believe something false; to mislead.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away, from") + ceive (variant of cap, "take") → to take away from the truth, to mislead.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开、偏离）+ ceive（cap 的变体，拿）→ 拿离真相，即欺骗。

definition.en: To break free from confinement or control; an act of escaping.

morphology_note.en: es- (from ex-, "out of") + cape (variant of cap, "cloak/seize") → to slip out of one's cloak (when seized), to flee.
morphology_note.zh: es-（源自 ex-，从……中出来）+ cape（cap 的变体，斗篷/抓住）→ 从被抓住时的斗篷中脱出，即逃跑。

definition.en: To reside or have one's place in; to fill or take up a space or time.

morphology_note.en: oc- (from ob-, "toward") + cup (variant of cap, "take, seize") + -y → to seize toward, to take possession of.
morphology_note.zh: oc-（源自 ob-，向）+ cup（cap 的变体，拿、夺取）+ -y → 向前夺取，即占据。

definition.en: To expect or look forward to something; to act in advance of.

morphology_note.en: anti- (from ante-, "before") + cip (variant of cap, "take") + -ate (verb) → to take before it happens, to foresee.
morphology_note.zh: anti-（源自 ante-，在……之前）+ cip（cap 的变体，拿）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 在事情发生前拿取，即预期。

definition.en: The most important city of a country; wealth used to generate more wealth.

morphology_note.en: cap ("head, chief") + -it- + -al (adjective/noun) → relating to the head, chief city or main wealth.
morphology_note.zh: cap（头、首要）+ -it- + -al（形容词/名词后缀）→ 与头部/首要相关的，即首都或资本。

definition.en: A road vehicle powered by an engine, designed to carry a small number of people.

morphology_note.en: From the root car/curr ("run, move"). Originally a wheeled vehicle that moves/runs.
morphology_note.zh: 源自词根 car/curr（跑、移动）。原指有轮的移动/行驶工具。

definition.en: To move something from one place to another; to support the weight of.

morphology_note.en: car ("run, move") + -ry (verb ending) → to move something from place to place.
morphology_note.zh: car（跑、移动）+ -ry（动词词尾）→ 把东西从一处移到另一处，即搬运。

definition.en: An occupation or profession pursued for a significant period of one's life.

morphology_note.en: car ("run, move") + -eer (noun suffix) → one's running course through life, a career.
morphology_note.zh: car（跑、移动）+ -eer（名词后缀）→ 人生的奔跑轨迹，即职业生涯。

definition.en: A strong open vehicle with two or four wheels, used for carrying loads.

morphology_note.en: car ("run, move") + -t → a vehicle that moves or runs, a cart.
morphology_note.zh: car（跑、移动）+ -t → 可以移动的运载工具，即车。

definition.en: A movable indicator on a computer screen; a sliding part of a measuring instrument.

morphology_note.en: curs (variant of car, "run") + -or (agent suffix) → a runner, something that runs across a surface.
morphology_note.zh: curs（car 的变体，跑）+ -or（施事者后缀）→ 奔跑者，即在表面移动的东西。

definition.en: Hasty and therefore not thorough or detailed.

morphology_note.en: curs (variant of car, "run") + -ory (adjective suffix) → running quickly, hence hasty and superficial.
morphology_note.zh: curs（car 的变体，跑）+ -ory（形容词后缀）→ 快速跑过的，即粗略的。

definition.en: To become subject to something unpleasant as a result of one's actions.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into, upon") + cur (variant of car, "run") → to run into, to bring upon oneself.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入、遭遇）+ cur（car 的变体，跑）→ 跑入，即招致。

definition.en: To agree with someone or something; to happen at the same time.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + cur (variant of car, "run") → to run together, to agree.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ cur（car 的变体，跑）→ 一起跑，即意见一致。

definition.en: To release from duty or obligation; to emit or pour out.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("away, reverse") + charge (from car, "load, carry") → to unload, to release.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（离开、相反）+ charge（源自 car，装载、运送）→ 卸载，即释放。

definition.en: A long passage in a building from which doors lead into rooms.

morphology_note.en: cor- (variant of car, "run") + -ridor (place suffix) → a place for running through, a passageway.
morphology_note.zh: cor-（car 的变体，跑）+ -ridor（场所后缀）→ 供通行的场所，即走廊。

definition.en: A festive season with public entertainment; a travelling amusement show.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -i- + -val (from Latin levare, "remove") → the farewell to meat before Lent.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -i- + -val（源自拉丁语 levare，移除）→ 大斋期前与肉告别的庆典。

definition.en: Relating to physical or bodily desires and appetites; sensual.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -al (adjective suffix) → of the flesh, bodily.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 属于肉体的。

definition.en: Embodied in flesh, especially in human form; to embody or represent in a tangible form.
definition.zh: 化身的；具体化的；使具体化

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, into") + carn ("flesh") + -ate (adjective/verb) → put into flesh, embodied.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ carn（肉）+ -ate（形容词/动词后缀）→ 进入肉体，即化身的。

definition.en: To be born again in another body after death.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + in- ("into") + carn ("flesh") + -ate (verb) → to enter into flesh again, reborn.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ in-（进入）+ carn（肉）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 再次进入肉体，即转世。

definition.en: An animal that feeds on flesh.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -i- + vore ("devour") → one that devours flesh.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -i- + vore（吞食）→ 吞食肉类的动物。

definition.en: Feeding on animal flesh; meat-eating.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -i- + vor ("devour") + -ous (adjective) → flesh-devouring.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -i- + vor（吞食）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 吞食肉的，即食肉的。

definition.en: The killing of a large number of people; slaughter.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -age (noun suffix) → a great destruction of flesh, slaughter.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -age（名词后缀）→ 肉体的大规模毁灭，即屠杀。

definition.en: An animal that feeds on plants.

morphology_note.en: herb ("grass, plant") + -i- + vore ("devour") → one that devours plants.
morphology_note.zh: herb（草、植物）+ -i- + vore（吞食）→ 吞食植物的动物。

definition.en: An animal or person that eats both plants and animal flesh.

morphology_note.en: omni ("all") + vore ("devour") → one that devours all kinds of food.
morphology_note.zh: omni（全部）+ vore（吞食）→ 吞食所有种类食物的，即杂食动物。

definition.en: A cultivated plant with sweet-smelling pink, white, or red flowers.

morphology_note.en: carn ("flesh") + -ation (noun suffix) → flesh-colored, referring to the original pink color of the flower.
morphology_note.zh: carn（肉）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 肉色的，指这种花最初的粉色。

definition.en: To achieve the desired aim; to come after and take the place of.

morphology_note.en: suc- (from sub-, "under, after") + ceed (variant of ced, "go") → to go after, to follow and achieve.
morphology_note.zh: suc-（源自 sub-，在……之后）+ ceed（ced 的变体，走）→ 跟着走，即成功或继任。

definition.en: The accomplishment of an aim or purpose; a person or thing that achieves desired aims.

morphology_note.en: suc- ("after") + cess (variant of ced, "go") → the outcome of going forward, achievement.
morphology_note.zh: suc-（在……之后）+ cess（ced 的变体，走）→ 前进的结果，即成功。

definition.en: To be greater than; to go beyond what is allowed or expected.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out, beyond") + ceed (variant of ced, "go") → to go beyond, to surpass.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（超出、超越）+ ceed（ced 的变体，走）→ 走出去/超出，即超越。

definition.en: The means or opportunity to approach or enter; to retrieve or obtain.

morphology_note.en: ac- (from ad-, "to") + cess (variant of ced, "go") → to go toward, a way of approach.
morphology_note.zh: ac-（源自 ad-，向）+ cess（ced 的变体，走）→ 走向，即通道/进入。

definition.en: To begin or continue a course of action; to move forward.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + ceed (variant of ced, "go") → to go forward.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ ceed（ced 的变体，走）→ 向前走，即继续进行。

definition.en: A series of actions or steps taken to achieve a result; to perform operations on data.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + cess (variant of ced, "go") → a going forward, a progression of steps.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ cess（ced 的变体，走）→ 前进的过程，即流程。

definition.en: To come before something in time, order, or position.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + cede (from ced, "go") → to go before.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之前）+ cede（源自 ced，走）→ 走在前面，即先于。

definition.en: Never done or known before; without previous example.
definition.zh: 前所未有的；史无前例的

morphology_note.en: un- ("not") + pre- ("before") + ced ("go") + -ent- + -ed → without anything that went before, never seen before.
morphology_note.zh: un-（不）+ pre-（在……之前）+ ced（走）+ -ent- + -ed → 没有先例的。

definition.en: A period of temporary economic decline; the act of receding.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + cess (variant of ced, "go") + -ion (noun) → a going back, a decline.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回、退）+ cess（ced 的变体，走）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 后退，即衰退。

definition.en: To admit that something is true; to surrender or yield.

morphology_note.en: con- ("with, completely") + cede (from ced, "go") → to go along with, to yield.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ cede（源自 ced，走）→ 完全退让，即让步。

definition.en: Required to be done or achieved; essential.

morphology_note.en: ne- ("not") + cess (variant of ced, "go, yield") + -ary (adjective) → not yielding, unavoidable.
morphology_note.zh: ne-（不）+ cess（ced 的变体，走、让步）+ -ary（形容词后缀）→ 不可退让的，即必要的。

definition.en: An established or official way of doing something.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + ced ("go") + -ure (noun suffix) → a way of going forward, a method.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ ced（走）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 前进的方式，即程序。

definition.en: Something kept hidden from others; not known or seen by others.

morphology_note.en: se- ("apart") + cret (variant of cern, "separate, sift") → set apart, hidden from view.
morphology_note.zh: se-（分开）+ cret（cern 的变体，分离、筛选）→ 分离开的，即隐藏的。

definition.en: A person employed to handle correspondence and manage affairs; a government official.

morphology_note.en: secret ("hidden, confidential") + -ary (person suffix) → one entrusted with secrets, a secretary.
morphology_note.zh: secret（秘密的、机密的）+ -ary（人物后缀）→ 被托付秘密的人，即秘书。

definition.en: To produce and discharge a substance from a cell or gland; to hide something.

morphology_note.en: se- ("apart") + crete (variant of cern, "separate") → to separate out, to produce by separation.
morphology_note.zh: se-（分开）+ crete（cern 的变体，分离）→ 分离出来，即分泌。

definition.en: To perceive or recognize something clearly; to distinguish.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + cern ("separate, sift") → to sift apart, to distinguish clearly.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ cern（分离、筛选）→ 筛分开来，即辨别。

definition.en: Able to be perceived or recognized; distinguishable.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + cern ("sift") + -ible ("able to be") → able to be sifted apart, recognizable.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ cern（筛选）+ -ible（能够被）→ 能够被筛分的，即可辨别的。

definition.en: Individually separate and distinct.
definition.zh: 分离的；离散的；不连续的

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + crete (variant of cern, "separate") → separated apart, individually distinct.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ crete（cern 的变体，分离）→ 各自分开的，即离散的。

definition.en: Careful and prudent in speech or action to avoid causing offense or revealing private information.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + creet (variant of cern, "sift, judge") → able to sift and judge, hence prudent.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ creet（cern 的变体，筛选、判断）→ 能够筛选判断的，即谨慎的。

definition.en: The ability to judge well; keen perception or insight.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + cern ("sift") + -ment (noun suffix) → the quality of sifting well, good judgment.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ cern（筛选）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 善于筛选的品质，即洞察力。

definition.en: A detailed and factual written account of past events.
definition.zh: 对过去事件的详细记录。

morphology_note.en: chron ("time") + -icle (noun suffix) -> a record anchored in time.
morphology_note.zh: chron（时间）+ -icle（名词后缀）→ 以时间为线索的记录。

definition.en: To make a choice or come to a conclusion after consideration.

morphology_note.en: de- ("off, away") + cide (from cid, "cut") → to cut off alternatives, to make a firm choice.
morphology_note.zh: de-（去除）+ cide（源自 cid，切）→ 切断其他选项，即做出决定。

definition.en: A conclusion or resolution reached after consideration.

morphology_note.en: de- ("off") + cis (variant of cid, "cut") + -ion (noun) → the act of cutting off options, a decision.
morphology_note.zh: de-（去除）+ cis（cid 的变体，切）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 切断选择的行为，即决定。

definition.en: Settling an issue quickly and effectively; having the ability to make decisions firmly.

morphology_note.en: de- ("off") + cis (variant of cid, "cut") + -ive (adjective) → tending to cut through, resolute.
morphology_note.zh: de-（去除）+ cis（cid 的变体，切）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于切断犹豫的，即果断的。

definition.en: Marked by exactness and accuracy; clearly expressed.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + cise (variant of cid, "cut") → cut beforehand, trimmed to exactness.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之前）+ cise（cid 的变体，切）→ 事先裁剪好的，即精确的。

definition.en: Giving a lot of information clearly and in a few words; brief but comprehensive.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together, thoroughly") + cise (variant of cid, "cut") → thoroughly cut, trimmed down to essentials.
morphology_note.zh: con-（彻底地）+ cise（cid 的变体，切）→ 彻底裁剪的，即简洁的。

definition.en: Intelligently analytical and clear-thinking; sharp.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + cis (variant of cid, "cut") + -ive (adjective) → cutting into, sharp and penetrating.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ cis（cid 的变体，切）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 切入的，即犀利的。

definition.en: The act of intentionally causing one's own death.

morphology_note.en: sui ("self") + cide (from cid, "cut, kill") → to cut/kill oneself.
morphology_note.zh: sui（自己）+ cide（源自 cid，切、杀）→ 杀死自己，即自杀。

definition.en: A substance used for destroying insects or other organisms harmful to cultivated plants.

morphology_note.en: pest ("pest, harmful creature") + -i- + cide (from cid, "kill") → something that kills pests.
morphology_note.zh: pest（害虫）+ -i- + cide（源自 cid，杀）→ 杀害虫的物质，即杀虫剂。

definition.en: To cut out surgically; a tax levied on certain goods.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + cise (variant of cid, "cut") → to cut out.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ cise（cid 的变体，切）→ 切除。

definition.en: An instrument with two blades joined for cutting paper, cloth, etc.

morphology_note.en: sciss (from cid, "cut") + -ors (instrument suffix) → a cutting instrument.
morphology_note.zh: sciss（源自 cid，切）+ -ors（工具后缀）→ 切割工具，即剪刀。

definition.en: A round plane figure; a group of people with shared interests; to move around.

morphology_note.en: circ ("ring, round") + -le (diminutive suffix) → a small ring shape, a circle.
morphology_note.zh: circ（环、圆）+ -le（小词后缀）→ 小环形，即圆。

definition.en: Having the form of a circle; moving around in a circle.

morphology_note.en: circ ("ring") + -ul- + -ar (adjective suffix) → shaped like a ring, round.
morphology_note.zh: circ（环）+ -ul- + -ar（形容词后缀）→ 像环一样的形状，即圆形的。

definition.en: To move continuously through a closed system; to pass from person to person.

morphology_note.en: circ ("ring") + -ul- + -ate (verb suffix) → to move in a ring, to go around.
morphology_note.zh: circ（环）+ -ul- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 沿环形运动，即循环。

definition.en: A roughly circular line or route; a complete path for electrical current.

morphology_note.en: circ ("ring, around") + -u- + -it ("go") → to go around, a closed loop.
morphology_note.zh: circ（环、周围）+ -u- + -it（走）→ 绕行一周，即回路。

definition.en: A condition or fact connected with an event or situation.

morphology_note.en: circum- (from circ, "around") + st ("stand") + -ance (noun) → what stands around, the surrounding conditions.
morphology_note.zh: circum-（源自 circ，周围）+ st（站立）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 围绕着站立的东西，即环境。

definition.en: The distance around a circular object; the boundary of a circle.

morphology_note.en: circum- (from circ, "around") + fer ("carry") + -ence (noun) → to carry around, the distance around.
morphology_note.zh: circum-（源自 circ，周围）+ fer（携带）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 绕一圈携带，即周长。

definition.en: To form a circle around; to surround.

morphology_note.en: en- ("make, put in") + circle (from circ, "ring") → to make a circle around, to surround.
morphology_note.zh: en-（使）+ circle（源自 circ，环）→ 使成环形围绕，即包围。

definition.en: A series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order; to ride a bicycle.

morphology_note.en: cycl (from Greek kyklos, related to circ, "circle, ring") + -e → a circular sequence, a cycle.
morphology_note.zh: cycl（源自希腊语 kyklos，与 circ 相关，圆、环）+ -e → 圆形序列，即循环。

definition.en: To convert waste into reusable material.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + cycle (from circ, "circle") → to cycle again, to reuse materials.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ cycle（源自 circ，循环）→ 再次循环，即回收利用。

definition.en: A comprehensive reference work covering all branches of knowledge.

morphology_note.en: en- ("in") + cyclo (from circ, "circle, all-around") + pedia ("education") → all-around education, comprehensive knowledge.
morphology_note.zh: en-（在……中）+ cyclo（源自 circ，圆、全面）+ pedia（教育）→ 全面的教育，即百科全书。

definition.en: To state or assert something as a fact; a demand for something as one's due.

morphology_note.en: From Latin clamare ("to shout, cry out"). To call out for what is due.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 clamare（喊叫、呼喊）。为应得之物而呼喊。

definition.en: To cry out suddenly in surprise, strong emotion, or pain.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + claim ("cry out") → to cry out loudly.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ claim（喊叫）→ 大声呼喊，即惊叫。

definition.en: A sudden cry or remark expressing surprise, pain, or emotion.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + clam (variant of claim, "cry") + -ation (noun) → the act of crying out.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ clam（claim 的变体，喊叫）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 呼喊的行为。

definition.en: To announce officially or publicly.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forth, forward") + claim ("cry out") → to cry forth publicly, to announce.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ claim（喊叫）→ 向前方呼喊，即公开宣布。

definition.en: To praise enthusiastically and publicly; enthusiastic approval.

morphology_note.en: ac- (from ad-, "to") + claim ("cry out") → to cry out toward, to praise loudly.
morphology_note.zh: ac-（源自 ad-，向）+ claim（喊叫）→ 向某人呼喊，即称赞。

definition.en: To retrieve or recover something previously lost; to make land usable.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + claim ("call out, demand") → to call back, to recover what was lost.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ claim（呼喊、要求）→ 呼喊要回来，即收回。

definition.en: To deny or renounce a claim or connection with.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("away, not") + claim ("demand, call out") → to call away from, to deny a claim.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（否定）+ claim（要求、呼喊）→ 拒绝要求，即否认。

definition.en: A loud and confused noise; to shout loudly.

morphology_note.en: clam (variant of claim, "cry out") + -our (noun suffix) → a loud crying out, an uproar.
morphology_note.zh: clam（claim 的变体，喊叫）+ -our（名词后缀）→ 大声叫喊，即喧嚷。

definition.en: An action that constitutes a serious offense against the law.

morphology_note.en: From Latin crimen ("accusation, offense"). The root crim means "to judge, accuse, separate".
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 crimen（指控、罪行）。词根 crim 意为"判断、指控、区分"。

definition.en: A person who has committed a crime; relating to crime.

morphology_note.en: crim ("accusation, offense") + -in- + -al (adjective/noun) → relating to crime or one who commits crime.
morphology_note.zh: crim（指控、罪行）+ -in- + -al（形容词/名词后缀）→ 与犯罪有关的，或犯罪者。

definition.en: The scientific study of crime and criminals.

morphology_note.en: crim ("crime") + -in- + -o- + -logy ("study") → the study of crime.
morphology_note.zh: crim（犯罪）+ -in- + -o- + -logy（学科）→ 研究犯罪的学科。

definition.en: To recognize a distinction; to treat a person unfairly based on prejudice.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + crim ("separate, judge") + -in- + -ate (verb) → to separate apart, to distinguish or treat differently.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ crim（分离、判断）+ -in- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 分开对待，即歧视或辨别。

definition.en: Unjust treatment of different categories of people; the ability to distinguish.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + crim ("judge, separate") + -in- + -ation (noun) → the act of separating apart, treating differently.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ crim（判断、分离）+ -in- + -ation（名词后缀）→ 区别对待的行为。

definition.en: To make someone appear guilty of a crime or wrongdoing.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, into") + crim ("accuse, crime") + -in- + -ate (verb) → to bring into a crime, to accuse.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ crim（指控、犯罪）+ -in- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 使牵涉犯罪，即控告。

definition.en: Done at random or without careful judgment.
definition.zh: 不加区分的；任意的；不分青红皂白的

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + discriminate ("distinguish") → not distinguishing, random.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ discriminate（区分）→ 不加区分的，即任意的。

definition.en: The arts, customs, and social institutions of a particular group; the cultivation of organisms.

morphology_note.en: cult ("cultivate, tend") + -ure (noun suffix) → the result of cultivating, culture.
morphology_note.zh: cult（耕种、培养）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 培养的成果，即文化。

definition.en: Relating to the ideas, customs, and social behavior of a society.

morphology_note.en: cult ("cultivate") + -ur- + -al (adjective) → relating to cultivation/culture.
morphology_note.zh: cult（耕种）+ -ur- + -al（形容词后缀）→ 与文化相关的。

definition.en: To prepare land for crops; to develop a quality, skill, or relationship.

morphology_note.en: cult ("cultivate, till") + -iv- + -ate (verb suffix) → to till the soil, to develop.
morphology_note.zh: cult（耕种、培养）+ -iv- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 耕种土地，引申为培养。

definition.en: The science or practice of farming, including cultivation of soil and raising of animals.

morphology_note.en: agri ("field") + cult ("cultivate") + -ure (noun) → the cultivation of fields, farming.
morphology_note.zh: agri（田地）+ cult（耕种）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 耕种田地，即农业。

definition.en: Relating to or containing several cultural or ethnic groups.

morphology_note.en: multi- ("many") + cult ("cultivate") + -ur- + -al (adjective) → of many cultures.
morphology_note.zh: multi-（多）+ cult（培养）+ -ur- + -al（形容词后缀）→ 多种文化的。

definition.en: The art or practice of garden cultivation and management.

morphology_note.en: horti ("garden") + cult ("cultivate") + -ure (noun) → the cultivation of gardens.
morphology_note.zh: horti（花园）+ cult（耕种）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 耕种花园，即园艺。

definition.en: A cultural group within a larger culture, often with beliefs or interests distinct from the mainstream.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("under, below") + culture → a culture within a larger culture.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（在……之下）+ culture（文化）→ 大文化之下的文化，即亚文化。

definition.en: Characterized by refined taste and manners; educated.

morphology_note.en: cult ("cultivate") + -ur- + -ed (adjective) → having been cultivated, refined.
morphology_note.zh: cult（培养）+ -ur- + -ed（形容词后缀）→ 被培养过的，即有教养的。

definition.en: A period of ten years.

morphology_note.en: dec ("ten, fitting, proper") + -ade (noun suffix) → a group of ten (years).
morphology_note.zh: dec（十、合适的）+ -ade（名词后缀）→ 十个（年）的一组，即十年。

definition.en: To make something look more attractive by adding extra items or ornament.

morphology_note.en: dec ("fitting, beautiful") + -or- + -ate (verb suffix) → to make fitting or beautiful.
morphology_note.zh: dec（合适的、美丽的）+ -or- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 使变得合适或美丽，即装饰。

definition.en: The process of decorating; an ornamental item.

morphology_note.en: dec ("fitting") + -or- + -ation (noun suffix) → the act of making fitting, an ornament.
morphology_note.zh: dec（合适的）+ -or- + -ation（名词后缀）→ 使合适的行为，即装饰。

definition.en: Serving to make something look more attractive; ornamental.

morphology_note.en: dec ("fitting") + -or- + -ative (adjective) → serving to make fitting or beautiful.
morphology_note.zh: dec（合适的）+ -or- + -ative（形容词后缀）→ 用于使之美观的。

definition.en: Polite and restrained in a way that is socially correct.
definition.zh: 得体的；端庄的；有礼貌的

morphology_note.en: dec ("fitting, proper") + -or- + -ous (adjective) → fitting and proper in behavior.
morphology_note.zh: dec（合适的、得体的）+ -or- + -ous（形容词后缀）→ 行为得体的。

definition.en: The furnishing and decoration of a room or building.

morphology_note.en: dec ("fitting, beautiful") + -or (noun suffix) → what makes a place fitting, decor.
morphology_note.zh: dec（合适的、美丽的）+ -or（名词后缀）→ 使场所合适的东西，即装潢。

definition.en: Not conforming with generally accepted standards of behavior; offensive.
definition.zh: 不雅的；下流的；不得体的

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + dec ("fitting, proper") + -ent (adjective) → not fitting, improper.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ dec（合适的、得体的）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 不得体的。

definition.en: A book or electronic resource that lists words and gives their meanings.

morphology_note.en: dic ("say, speak") + -tion- + -ary (collection) → a collection of sayings/words.
morphology_note.zh: dic（说）+ -tion- + -ary（集合）→ 词语的集合，即词典。

definition.en: A ruler with total power over a country, typically one who governs by force.

morphology_note.en: dic ("say, command") + -tat- + -or (agent) → one who commands, a dictator.
morphology_note.zh: dic（说、命令）+ -tat- + -or（施事者）→ 发号施令的人，即独裁者。

definition.en: To say or estimate that something will happen in the future.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + dict (variant of dic, "say") → to say beforehand, to foretell.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之前）+ dict（dic 的变体，说）→ 事先说出，即预测。

definition.en: To assert the opposite of a statement; to deny or be inconsistent with.

morphology_note.en: contra- ("against") + dict (variant of dic, "say") → to say against, to oppose.
morphology_note.zh: contra-（反对）+ dict（dic 的变体，说）→ 说反话，即反驳。

definition.en: To point out or show; to be a sign of.

morphology_note.en: in- ("toward") + dic ("say, point") + -ate (verb) → to point toward, to show.
morphology_note.zh: in-（向）+ dic（说、指）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 指向，即指示。

definition.en: A person physically or mentally dependent on a substance or activity.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to") + dict (variant of dic, "say, assign") → assigned to, given over to a habit.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（向）+ dict（dic 的变体，说、指定）→ 被指定给、被交付于某习惯，即上瘾。

definition.en: The state of something; a circumstance that must be met; to train or accustom.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + dit (variant of dic, "say, declare") + -ion (noun) → what is declared together, agreed terms.
morphology_note.zh: con-（共同）+ dit（dic 的变体，说、宣布）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 共同宣布的事项，即条件。

definition.en: A decision on an issue in a civil or criminal case; a judgment or opinion.

morphology_note.en: ver ("true") + dict (variant of dic, "say") → a true saying, a judgment spoken as truth.
morphology_note.zh: ver（真实的）+ dict（dic 的变体，说）→ 说出真相，即裁决。

definition.en: Able to be predicted; behaving or occurring in a way that is expected.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + dict ("say") + -able ("able to be") → able to be said beforehand.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之前）+ dict（说）+ -able（能够被）→ 能够被事先说出的，即可预测的。

definition.en: The utterance of a blessing; a prayer invoking divine care.

morphology_note.en: bene- ("good, well") + dic ("say") + -tion (noun) → to say good things, a blessing.
morphology_note.zh: bene-（好的）+ dic（说）+ -tion（名词后缀）→ 说好话，即祝福。

definition.en: To give money or goods to a charitable cause.

morphology_note.en: don (variant of dit, "give") + -ate (verb suffix) → to give freely.
morphology_note.zh: don（dit 的变体，给予）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 自愿给予，即捐赠。

definition.en: Something given to a charity; the act of donating.

morphology_note.en: don ("give") + -ation (noun suffix) → the act of giving.
morphology_note.zh: don（给予）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 给予的行为，即捐赠。

definition.en: The act of forgiving an offense; to forgive or excuse.

morphology_note.en: par- (from per-, "thoroughly") + don (variant of dit, "give") → to give thoroughly, to forgive completely.
morphology_note.zh: par-（源自 per-，彻底地）+ don（dit 的变体，给予）→ 彻底给予，即完全宽恕。

definition.en: A custom or belief passed from generation to generation.

morphology_note.en: tra- (from trans-, "across") + dit ("give") + -ion (noun) → something given across generations.
morphology_note.zh: tra-（源自 trans-，跨越）+ dit（给予）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 跨代传递的东西，即传统。

definition.en: Existing in or as part of a tradition; long-established.

morphology_note.en: tradition (from tra- + dit, "give across") + -al (adjective) → of or pertaining to tradition.
morphology_note.zh: tradition（源自 tra- + dit，跨代给予）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 关于传统的。

definition.en: A particular form of a published text; a version of something.

morphology_note.en: e- (from ex-, "out") + dit ("give") + -ion (noun) → something given out, published.
morphology_note.zh: e-（源自 ex-，向外）+ dit（给予）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 给予出去的东西，即出版物。

definition.en: A person who is in charge of and determines the content of a publication.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + dit ("give") + -or (agent) → one who gives out/publishes, an editor.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ dit（给予）+ -or（施事者）→ 把内容给出去的人，即编辑。

definition.en: A short, entertaining account of a real incident or person.

morphology_note.en: an- ("not") + ec- ("out") + dote (variant of dit, "give") → something not given out publicly, unpublished tales.
morphology_note.zh: an-（不）+ ec-（向外）+ dote（dit 的变体，给予）→ 未公开的故事，即轶事。

definition.en: A medicine taken to counteract poison; something that counteracts an unpleasant situation.

morphology_note.en: anti- ("against") + dote (variant of dit, "give") → something given against poison.
morphology_note.zh: anti-（对抗）+ dote（dit 的变体，给予）→ 给予以对抗毒素的东西，即解毒剂。

definition.en: Facts and statistics collected for reference or analysis.

morphology_note.en: dat (variant of dit, "give") + -a (Latin plural) → things given, facts provided.
morphology_note.zh: dat（dit 的变体，给予）+ -a（拉丁语复数）→ 被给出的东西，即数据。

definition.en: The day of the month or year; a social or romantic appointment.

morphology_note.en: dat (variant of dit, "give") + -e → what is given (the day given), a date.
morphology_note.zh: dat（dit 的变体，给予）+ -e → 被给定的（被指定的日子），即日期。

definition.en: To accept or forgive behavior that is considered wrong.

morphology_note.en: con- ("completely") + done (variant of dit, "give") → to give away completely, to forgive.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ done（dit 的变体，给予）→ 完全给予宽恕，即纵容。

definition.en: To have a commanding influence over; to be the most important element.

morphology_note.en: dom ("master, house") + -in- + -ate (verb) → to act as master, to control.
morphology_note.zh: dom（主人、家）+ -in- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 充当主人，即支配。

definition.en: Having power and influence over others; most important or prevalent.

morphology_note.en: dom ("master") + -in- + -ant (adjective) → being master-like, prevailing.
morphology_note.zh: dom（主人）+ -in- + -ant（形容词后缀）→ 像主人一样的，即占主导的。

definition.en: An area of territory owned or controlled by a ruler; a sphere of activity or knowledge.

morphology_note.en: dom ("master, house") + -ain (noun suffix) → the territory of a master, a domain.
morphology_note.zh: dom（主人、家）+ -ain（名词后缀）→ 主人的领地，即领域。

definition.en: Relating to the home or family; of one's own country.

morphology_note.en: dom ("house, home") + -est- + -ic (adjective) → of the house, relating to home or country.
morphology_note.zh: dom（家、住所）+ -est- + -ic（形容词后缀）→ 属于家的，即家庭的/国内的。

definition.en: To tame an animal and keep it as a pet or for farming.

morphology_note.en: domestic (from dom, "house") + -ate (verb) → to make part of the household, to tame.
morphology_note.zh: domestic（源自 dom，家）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使成为家的一部分，即驯化。

definition.en: A rounded vault forming the roof of a building.

morphology_note.en: dom ("house") + -e → the house of God (from Latin domus), a cathedral roof shape.
morphology_note.zh: dom（家、房屋）+ -e → 上帝之家（源自拉丁语 domus），指大教堂的屋顶形状。

definition.en: A country ruled by a king or queen; a realm or domain.

morphology_note.en: king + -dom (suffix from dom, "domain, realm") → the domain of a king.
morphology_note.zh: king（国王）+ -dom（源自 dom 的后缀，领域）→ 国王的领地，即王国。

definition.en: The state of being free; the power to act, speak, or think freely.

morphology_note.en: free + -dom (suffix from dom, "state, realm") → the state of being free.
morphology_note.zh: free（自由的）+ -dom（源自 dom 的后缀，状态、领域）→ 自由的状态。

definition.en: Present as the strongest or main element; having superior strength or influence.
definition.zh: 主要的；占优势的；显著的

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before, above") + dom ("master") + -in- + -ant (adjective) → mastering above others, prevailing.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之上）+ dom（主人）+ -in- + -ant（形容词后缀）→ 凌驾于他人之上的，即占优势的。

definition.en: The possibility of suffering harm or injury; a cause of harm.

morphology_note.en: dan- (from dom, "master, power") + -ger → being under someone's power, hence in peril.
morphology_note.zh: dan-（源自 dom，主人、权力）+ -ger → 处于某人的权力之下，即处于危险中。

definition.en: A residential building at a college or university; short for dormitory.

morphology_note.en: From Latin dormire ("to sleep"). A place for sleeping.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 dormire（睡觉）。睡觉的地方。

definition.en: A large sleeping room with many beds; a residential hall.

morphology_note.en: dorm ("sleep") + -itory (place suffix) → a place for sleeping.
morphology_note.zh: dorm（睡觉）+ -itory（场所后缀）→ 睡觉的场所，即宿舍。

definition.en: In a state of rest or inactivity; temporarily inactive.

morphology_note.en: dorm ("sleep") + -ant (adjective) → sleeping, inactive.
morphology_note.zh: dorm（睡觉）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 正在沉睡的，即休眠的。

definition.en: The state of being dormant; a period of inactivity.

morphology_note.en: dorm ("sleep") + -ancy (noun suffix for state) → the state of sleeping, inactivity.
morphology_note.zh: dorm（睡觉）+ -ancy（状态名词后缀）→ 沉睡的状态，即休眠。

definition.en: To adjust to new conditions or circumstances.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to") + apt (variant form related to ept, "fit") → to make fit, to adjust.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（向）+ apt（与 ept 相关的变体，适合）→ 使适合，即适应。

definition.en: Relating to or characterized by adaptation.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to") + apt ("fit") + -ive (adjective) → tending to fit, adaptive.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（向）+ apt（适合）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于适应的。

definition.en: Able to adjust to new conditions easily.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to") + apt ("fit") + -able ("able to be") → able to be fitted to new conditions.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（向）+ apt（适合）+ -able（能够）→ 能够适应新条件的。

definition.en: Very skilled or proficient at something.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to, thoroughly") + ept (variant of apt, "fit, skilled") → thoroughly fit, highly skilled.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（彻底地）+ ept（apt 的变体，适合、熟练）→ 非常适合的，即熟练的。

definition.en: To legally take another's child as one's own; to take up or follow an idea or practice.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("to") + opt (variant related to apt, "choose, fit") → to choose as one's own, to take up.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（向）+ opt（与 apt 相关的变体，选择、适合）→ 选为己有，即收养或采纳。

definition.en: A thing that is known to be true; reality as opposed to opinion.

morphology_note.en: fac ("make, do") + -t → something made/done, hence a deed or truth.
morphology_note.zh: fac（做、制造）+ -t → 被做出的事情，即事实。

definition.en: A circumstance or element contributing to a result.

morphology_note.en: fac ("make, do") + -tor (agent suffix) → one who makes/does, a contributing element.
morphology_note.zh: fac（做、制造）+ -tor（施事者后缀）→ 做事的人/元素，即因素。

definition.en: A building or group of buildings where goods are manufactured.

morphology_note.en: fac ("make") + -tory (place suffix) → a place where things are made.
morphology_note.zh: fac（制造）+ -tory（场所后缀）→ 制造东西的地方，即工厂。

definition.en: To have an influence on; to produce a change in.

morphology_note.en: af- (from ad-, "to") + fect (variant of fac, "make, do") → to do something to, to influence.
morphology_note.zh: af-（源自 ad-，向）+ fect（fac 的变体，做）→ 对……做某事，即影响。

definition.en: A change produced by an action or cause; a result.

morphology_note.en: ef- (from ex-, "out") + fect (variant of fac, "make") → something made out, a result.
morphology_note.zh: ef-（源自 ex-，出）+ fect（fac 的变体，做）→ 做出来的东西，即结果。

definition.en: To contaminate with a disease-causing organism.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, into") + fect (variant of fac, "make, do") → to make into, to contaminate.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ fect（fac 的变体，做）→ 做入其中，即感染。

definition.en: Having all the required qualities; free from any flaw; to make complete.

morphology_note.en: per- ("thoroughly, completely") + fect (variant of fac, "make") → made completely, without flaw.
morphology_note.zh: per-（彻底地）+ fect（fac 的变体，做）→ 彻底完成的，即完美的。

definition.en: A shortcoming or imperfection; to abandon a cause or country.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away, down") + fect (variant of fac, "make") → unmade, lacking, a flaw.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开、不足）+ fect（fac 的变体，做）→ 未做好的，即缺陷。

definition.en: Enough; adequate for the purpose.

morphology_note.en: suf- (from sub-, "under, up to") + fic (variant of fac, "make") + -ient (adjective) → made up to the mark, enough.
morphology_note.zh: suf-（源自 sub-，向上到）+ fic（fac 的变体，做）+ -ient（形容词后缀）→ 做到标准，即足够的。

definition.en: Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort.

morphology_note.en: ef- (from ex-, "out") + fic (variant of fac, "make") + -ient (adjective) → making things come out well, productive.
morphology_note.zh: ef-（源自 ex-，出）+ fic（fac 的变体，做）+ -ient（形容词后缀）→ 做出好结果的，即高效的。

definition.en: Made by humans rather than occurring naturally; not genuine.

morphology_note.en: arti ("skill, art") + fic (variant of fac, "make") + -ial (adjective) → made by skill/art, not natural.
morphology_note.zh: arti（技艺、艺术）+ fic（fac 的变体，做）+ -ial（形容词后缀）→ 用技艺制造的，即人工的。

definition.en: Literature describing imaginary events and people; something invented or untrue.

morphology_note.en: fic (variant of fac, "make") + -tion (noun) → something made up, an invention.
morphology_note.zh: fic（fac 的变体，做）+ -tion（名词后缀）→ 编造出来的东西，即虚构。

definition.en: A room or building used for commercial or professional work; a position of authority.

morphology_note.en: of- (from opus, "work") + fic (variant of fac, "make, do") → a place of doing work.
morphology_note.zh: of-（源自 opus，工作）+ fic（fac 的变体，做）→ 做工作的地方，即办公室。

definition.en: An advantage or profit; to receive an advantage.

morphology_note.en: bene- ("good, well") + fit (variant of fac, "make, do") → to do good, a good deed or advantage.
morphology_note.zh: bene-（好的）+ fit（fac 的变体，做）→ 做好事，即利益。

definition.en: To like one thing better than another; to choose.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + fer ("carry, bear") → to carry before others, to favor.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在……之前）+ fer（携带、承载）→ 放在其他之前，即偏好。

definition.en: To grant a title or honor; to discuss something with someone.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + fer ("carry, bring") → to bring together, to consult or grant.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ fer（携带、带来）→ 带到一起，即协商或授予。

definition.en: To be unlike or distinct; to disagree.

morphology_note.en: dif- (from dis-, "apart") + fer ("carry") → to carry apart, to be distinct.
morphology_note.zh: dif-（源自 dis-，分开）+ fer（携带）→ 各自携带不同的东西，即相异。

definition.en: A point or way in which people or things are unlike.

morphology_note.en: dif- ("apart") + fer ("carry") + -ence (noun) → the state of being carried apart, a distinction.
morphology_note.zh: dif-（分开）+ fer（携带）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 被分开携带的状态，即差异。

definition.en: To direct attention to; to consult a source for information.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + fer ("carry") → to carry back, to direct back to a source.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ fer（携带）→ 带回去，即参考。

definition.en: To deduce or conclude from evidence and reasoning.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, into") + fer ("carry") → to carry in, to bring to a conclusion.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ fer（携带）→ 携带进来，即推断出结论。

definition.en: To put off to a later time; to yield to someone's opinion.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away, down") + fer ("carry") → to carry away/down, to postpone or yield.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开、向下）+ fer（携带）→ 携带离开，即推迟或顺从。

definition.en: To experience pain, distress, or hardship.

morphology_note.en: suf- (from sub-, "under") + fer ("carry, bear") → to carry under, to bear a burden.
morphology_note.zh: suf-（源自 sub-，在……之下）+ fer（携带、承受）→ 在重压下承受，即受苦。

definition.en: To move from one place or person to another.

morphology_note.en: trans- ("across") + fer ("carry") → to carry across, to move.
morphology_note.zh: trans-（跨越）+ fer（携带）→ 携带到对面，即转移。

definition.en: Producing abundant vegetation or offspring; inventive.
definition.zh: 肥沃的；能生育的；富有创造力的

morphology_note.en: fer ("carry, bear") + -tile (adjective suffix) → able to bear fruit, productive.
morphology_note.zh: fer（携带、结出）+ -tile（形容词后缀）→ 能结出果实的，即肥沃的。

definition.en: A formal meeting for discussion.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + fer ("bring") + -ence (noun) → a bringing together, a meeting.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ fer（带来）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 聚到一起，即会议。

definition.en: To admit or acknowledge a fault, crime, or wrongdoing.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together, fully") + fess ("speak, acknowledge") → to speak fully, to admit.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ fess（说、承认）→ 完全说出，即坦白。

definition.en: A formal statement admitting guilt; a declaration of religious beliefs.

morphology_note.en: con- ("fully") + fess ("speak") + -ion (noun) → the act of speaking fully, an admission.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ fess（说）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 完全说出的行为，即供认。

definition.en: To claim openly; to declare a belief or feeling.
definition.zh: 声称；公开表示；宣称信仰

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forth, publicly") + fess ("speak, declare") → to declare publicly.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（公开地）+ fess（说、宣布）→ 公开宣布，即声称。

definition.en: A university academic of the highest rank; a senior teacher.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("publicly") + fess ("declare") + -or (agent) → one who declares publicly, a teacher.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（公开地）+ fess（宣布）+ -or（施事者）→ 公开宣讲的人，即教授。

definition.en: A paid occupation requiring training and formal qualifications.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forth") + fess ("declare") + -ion (noun) → a public declaration of skill, a vocation.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ fess（宣布）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 公开宣布自己的技能，即职业。

definition.en: Relating to or connected with a profession; a person engaged in a profession.
definition.zh: 专业的；职业的；专业人士

morphology_note.en: profession + -al (adjective) → of or relating to a profession.
morphology_note.zh: profession（职业）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 与职业相关的，即专业的。

definition.en: Able to express oneself easily and smoothly; flowing.

morphology_note.en: flu ("flow") + -ent (adjective) → flowing smoothly, fluent.
morphology_note.zh: flu（流动）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 流畅的。

definition.en: The power to affect someone's character or actions; to have an effect on.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + flu ("flow") + -ence (noun) → flowing into, having an effect upon.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ flu（流动）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 流入，即影响。

definition.en: Having great influence on someone or something.

morphology_note.en: influence + -ial (adjective) → having the power to flow into and affect.
morphology_note.zh: influence（影响）+ -ial（形容词后缀）→ 有能力流入和影响的。

definition.en: Having a great deal of money; wealthy.

morphology_note.en: af- (from ad-, "to") + flu ("flow") + -ent (adjective) → flowing toward, having wealth flowing in.
morphology_note.zh: af-（源自 ad-，向）+ flu（流动）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 财富流向的，即富裕的。

definition.en: The junction of two rivers; a coming together of things.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + flu ("flow") + -ence (noun) → a flowing together.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ flu（流动）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 流到一起，即汇合。

definition.en: Unnecessary; more than what is needed.

morphology_note.en: super- ("over, above") + flu ("flow") + -ous (adjective) → flowing over, more than needed.
morphology_note.zh: super-（超过、在……之上）+ flu（流动）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 溢流的，即多余的。

definition.en: A substance that flows freely; smooth and graceful; not fixed.
definition.zh: 流体；液体；流动的；不固定的

morphology_note.en: flu ("flow") + -id (adjective/noun suffix) → that which flows, a liquid.
morphology_note.zh: flu（流动）+ -id（形容词/名词后缀）→ 能流动的，即流体。

definition.en: To make someone unable to think clearly; to mix up.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + fuse (variant of flu, "pour, flow") → to pour together, to mix up.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ fuse（flu 的变体，倾倒、流）→ 倒到一起，即混淆。

definition.en: To spread or scatter widely; spread out and not concentrated.

morphology_note.en: dif- (from dis-, "apart") + fuse (variant of flu, "pour") → to pour apart, to spread widely.
morphology_note.zh: dif-（源自 dis-，分散）+ fuse（flu 的变体，倾倒）→ 分散倒出，即扩散。

definition.en: To fill or inspire with a quality; to soak in liquid to extract flavor.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + fuse (variant of flu, "pour") → to pour into, to fill with.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ fuse（flu 的变体，倾倒）→ 倒入，即注入。

definition.en: The transfer of blood from one person to another.

morphology_note.en: trans- ("across") + fus (variant of flu, "pour") + -ion (noun) → a pouring across, the transfer of fluid.
morphology_note.zh: trans-（跨越）+ fus（flu 的变体，倾倒）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 跨过来倾倒，即输血。

definition.en: Strength or power exerted upon an object; to compel someone to do something.

morphology_note.en: From Latin fortis ("strong"). The root forc/fort means strength.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 fortis（强壮的）。词根 forc/fort 意为力量。

definition.en: To compel observance of a law or rule; to impose by authority.

morphology_note.en: en- ("make, cause") + force ("strength") → to make strong, to compel compliance.
morphology_note.zh: en-（使）+ force（力量）→ 使有力执行，即强制实施。

definition.en: To strengthen or support with additional material or assistance.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + in- ("make") + force ("strength") → to make strong again, to strengthen.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ in-（使）+ force（力量）→ 再次增强，即加固。

definition.en: A fortified building or strategic position.

morphology_note.en: From Latin fortis ("strong"). A strong, defended place.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 fortis（强壮的）。一个坚固的防御之所。

definition.en: To strengthen a place against attack; to encourage or invigorate.

morphology_note.en: fort ("strong") + -ify (verb suffix, "to make") → to make strong.
morphology_note.zh: fort（强壮的）+ -ify（动词后缀，使）→ 使变强，即加固。

definition.en: Courage in pain or adversity; mental and emotional strength.

morphology_note.en: fort ("strong") + -itude (noun suffix for quality) → the quality of being strong, courage.
morphology_note.zh: fort（强壮的）+ -itude（品质名词后缀）→ 强壮的品质，即刚毅。

definition.en: A vigorous or determined attempt; physical or mental exertion.

morphology_note.en: ef- (from ex-, "out") + fort ("strong") → to put out strength, exertion.
morphology_note.zh: ef-（源自 ex-，向外）+ fort（强壮的）→ 发出力量，即努力。

definition.en: A state of physical ease and well-being; to soothe in time of grief.

morphology_note.en: com- (from con-, "with, together") + fort ("strong") → to strengthen together, to console.
morphology_note.zh: com-（源自 con-，一起）+ fort（强壮的）→ 共同加强，即安慰。

definition.en: Providing physical ease; free from stress or constraint.

morphology_note.en: comfort (from com- + fort, "strengthen together") + -able ("able to") → able to be strengthened, at ease.
morphology_note.zh: comfort（安慰）+ -able（能够）→ 能够得到安慰的，即舒适的。

definition.en: Chance or luck as an external force affecting human affairs; a large amount of money.

morphology_note.en: From Latin fortuna ("chance, luck, fate"). Related to fors ("luck").
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 fortuna（机遇、运气、命运）。与 fors（运气）相关。

definition.en: Favored by or involving good luck; auspicious.

morphology_note.en: fortun ("luck, chance") + -ate (adjective) → having good luck.
morphology_note.zh: fortun（运气、机遇）+ -ate（形容词后缀）→ 有好运的，即幸运的。

definition.en: It is fortunate that; luckily.

morphology_note.en: fortunate + -ly (adverb) → in a fortunate manner.
morphology_note.zh: fortunate（幸运的）+ -ly（副词后缀）→ 以幸运的方式。

definition.en: Having or marked by bad fortune; unlucky.

morphology_note.en: un- ("not") + fortunate ("lucky") → not lucky, unfortunate.
morphology_note.zh: un-（不）+ fortunate（幸运的）→ 不幸运的。

definition.en: Bad luck; an unfortunate event.

morphology_note.en: mis- ("bad, wrong") + fortune ("luck") → bad luck.
morphology_note.zh: mis-（坏的、错误的）+ fortune（运气）→ 坏运气，即不幸。

definition.en: Happening by chance rather than design; accidental.

morphology_note.en: fortuit- (from fortuna, "chance") + -ous (adjective) → happening by chance.
morphology_note.zh: fortuit-（源自 fortuna，机遇）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 由机遇发生的，即偶然的。

definition.en: To establish or set up an institution or organization.

morphology_note.en: From Latin fundare ("to lay the bottom"). Fund means "bottom, base, foundation".
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 fundare（奠定基础）。fund 意为"底部、基础"。

definition.en: The basis on which something is built; an organization established for a charitable purpose.

morphology_note.en: found (from fund, "base") + -ation (noun) → the act of laying a base, a foundation.
morphology_note.zh: found（源自 fund，基础）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 奠定基础的行为，即基础。

definition.en: Forming a necessary base or core; of central importance.

morphology_note.en: fund ("base, bottom") + -a- + -ment- + -al (adjective) → relating to the base, essential.
morphology_note.zh: fund（基础、底部）+ -a- + -ment- + -al（形容词后缀）→ 关于基础的，即根本的。

definition.en: Very great or intense; having deep insight or knowledge.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forth, forward") + found (from fund, "bottom") → reaching to the very bottom, deep.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ found（源自 fund，底部）→ 达到最底部的，即深刻的。

definition.en: A sum of money saved or available for a purpose; to provide money for.

morphology_note.en: From Latin fundus ("bottom, base, estate"). Money as a financial base.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 fundus（底部、基础、财产）。作为经济基础的金钱。

definition.en: A repayment of a sum of money; to pay back.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + fund ("pour, base") → to pour back, to return money.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ fund（倾倒、基础）→ 倒回去，即退款。

definition.en: To cause surprise or confusion; to mix up.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + found (from fund, "pour, mix") → to pour together, to confuse.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ found（源自 fund，倾倒、混合）→ 倒在一起，即混淆。

definition.en: To collect money for a particular purpose, especially a charity.

morphology_note.en: fund ("money") + raise ("to collect, lift up") → to raise funds, to collect money.
morphology_note.zh: fund（资金）+ raise（募集、提高）→ 募集资金，即筹款。

definition.en: A unit of heredity that determines a particular characteristic of an organism.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, origin, produce") + -e → a unit of biological origin.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、起源、产生）+ -e → 生物起源的单位，即基因。

definition.en: Relating to genes or heredity.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, origin") + -etic (adjective) → relating to origin or heredity.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、起源）+ -etic（形容词后缀）→ 与起源或遗传相关的。

definition.en: To cause something to arise or come about; to produce.

morphology_note.en: gen ("produce, bring forth") + -er- + -ate (verb) → to bring forth, to produce.
morphology_note.zh: gen（产生、带来）+ -er- + -ate（动词后缀）→ 带来，即产生。

definition.en: All the people born around the same time; the production of something.

morphology_note.en: gen ("produce, birth") + -er- + -ation (noun) → the act of producing; those produced together.
morphology_note.zh: gen（产生、出生）+ -er- + -ation（名词后缀）→ 产生的行为；一起出生的人们。

definition.en: Showing a readiness to give more than is necessary; kind.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, noble origin") + -er- + -ous (adjective) → of noble birth, hence liberal and giving.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、高贵的出身）+ -er- + -ous（形容词后缀）→ 出身高贵的，引申为慷慨的。

definition.en: Truly what something is said to be; authentic.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, origin") + -u- + -ine (adjective) → of true origin, authentic.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、起源）+ -u- + -ine（形容词后缀）→ 出身真实的，即真正的。

definition.en: Affecting or concerning all or most people; a high-ranking military officer.

morphology_note.en: gen ("kind, class, birth") + -er- + -al (adjective) → of the whole class/kind, universal.
morphology_note.zh: gen（种类、类别、出生）+ -er- + -al（形容词后缀）→ 整个类别的，即普遍的。

definition.en: The state of being male or female; the social and cultural roles associated with sex.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, kind") + -der (from Latin genus) → the kind one is born as.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、种类）+ -der（源自拉丁语 genus）→ 出生时所属的类别，即性别。

definition.en: Exceptional intellectual or creative power; a person of such ability.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, spirit") + -ius (Latin noun) → an inborn spirit or talent.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、精神）+ -ius（拉丁语名词后缀）→ 与生俱来的精神或才能。

definition.en: Clever, original, and inventive.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in") + gen ("born, talent") + -ious (adjective) → born with talent, cleverly inventive.
morphology_note.zh: in-（在……中）+ gen（出生、才能）+ -ious（形容词后缀）→ 天生有才的，即巧妙的。

definition.en: Mild in temperament; kind and tender.

morphology_note.en: gen ("birth, noble") + -tle (adjective ending) → of noble birth, hence refined and kind.
morphology_note.zh: gen（出生、高贵）+ -tle（形容词词尾）→ 出身高贵的，引申为温和的。

definition.en: A chemical element essential for respiration and combustion.

morphology_note.en: oxy ("acid, sharp") + gen ("produce") → acid-producer (originally thought to produce all acids).
morphology_note.zh: oxy（酸、尖锐的）+ gen（产生）→ 产生酸的（最初被认为产生所有酸）。

definition.en: The science that deals with the earth’s physical structure and substance.
definition.zh: 研究地球物质和结构的科学。

morphology_note.en: geo ("earth") + -logy ("study of") -> the study of Earth.
morphology_note.zh: geo（地球）+ -logy（学科）→ 研究地球的学科。

definition.en: To put forward for consideration; to imply or indicate.

morphology_note.en: sug- (from sub-, "under") + gest ("carry, bring") → to bring under consideration.
morphology_note.zh: sug-（源自 sub-，在……之下）+ gest（携带、带来）→ 暗中带来，即建议。

definition.en: An idea or plan put forward for consideration.

morphology_note.en: sug- ("under") + gest ("carry") + -ion (noun) → something carried under, an idea offered.
morphology_note.zh: sug-（在……之下）+ gest（携带）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 从下面带来的东西，即建议。

definition.en: To break down food in the body; to absorb and understand information.

morphology_note.en: di- (from dis-, "apart") + gest ("carry") → to carry apart, to break down.
morphology_note.zh: di-（源自 dis-，分开）+ gest（携带）→ 分开携带，即消化。

definition.en: To make abnormally full or blocked; to overcrowd.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + gest ("carry, heap") → to heap together, to overcrowd.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ gest（携带、堆积）→ 堆积在一起，即拥塞。

definition.en: A movement of the body to express an idea or meaning.

morphology_note.en: gest ("carry, bear") + -ure (noun suffix) → something carried by the body, a bodily expression.
morphology_note.zh: gest（携带、承载）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 身体所承载的表达，即手势。

definition.en: An official list or record; to enter one's name on a list.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + gist (variant of gest, "carry, record") + -er → to carry back into record.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ gist（gest 的变体，携带、记录）+ -er → 带回记录中，即登记。

definition.en: To take food or drink into the body by swallowing.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + gest ("carry") → to carry into the body, to swallow.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ gest（携带）→ 携带进入体内，即摄取。

definition.en: To represent something as being larger or more important than it really is.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + ag- ("to") + ger (variant of gest, "carry, heap") + -ate → to heap up beyond measure, to overstate.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ ag-（向）+ ger（gest 的变体，堆积）+ -ate → 过度堆积，即夸大。

definition.en: To carry a fetus in the womb; to develop slowly over time.

morphology_note.en: gest ("carry, bear") + -ate (verb) → to carry within, to bear offspring.
morphology_note.zh: gest（携带、承载）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 在体内携带，即妊娠。

definition.en: The Earth; a spherical representation of the Earth; any spherical object.

morphology_note.en: From Latin globus ("round mass, sphere"). The root glob means "sphere, ball".
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 globus（圆形物体、球体）。词根 glob 意为"球、球体"。

definition.en: Relating to the whole world; comprehensive.

morphology_note.en: glob ("sphere, world") + -al (adjective) → of the whole world.
morphology_note.zh: glob（球体、世界）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 全世界的。

definition.en: In a way that relates to the whole world; worldwide.

morphology_note.en: global + -ly (adverb) → in a worldwide manner.
morphology_note.zh: global（全球的）+ -ly（副词后缀）→ 以全球的方式。

definition.en: To develop or be developed so as to make possible international influence or operation.

morphology_note.en: global + -ize (verb suffix, "to make") → to make global, to extend worldwide.
morphology_note.zh: global（全球的）+ -ize（动词后缀，使）→ 使全球化。

definition.en: The process by which businesses and organizations develop international influence.

morphology_note.en: globalize + -ation (noun) → the process of making global.
morphology_note.zh: globalize（全球化）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 全球化的过程。
