morphology_note.zh: nov（新的）+ -ice（名词后缀）→ 新来的人，即初学者。

definition.en: To introduce something new; to make changes in something established.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + nov ("new") + -ate (verb) → to bring in something new.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ nov（新的）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 引入新事物，即创新。

definition.en: A new method, idea, or product; the act of introducing something new.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + nov ("new") + -ation (noun) → the act of making new.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ nov（新的）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 使新的行为，即创新。

definition.en: Featuring new methods or ideas; original and creative.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + nov ("new") + -ative (adj.) → tending to bring in new things.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ nov（新的）+ -ative（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于引入新事物的。

definition.en: To restore to good condition; to repair and improve a building.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + nov ("new") + -ate (verb) → to make new again, to restore.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ nov（新的）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使再次变新，即翻新。

definition.en: The act of restoring something to good condition; the process of repairing and improving.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + nov ("new") + -ation (noun) → the act of making new again.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ nov（新的）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 再次使新的行为，即翻新。

definition.en: The point or place where something begins; ancestry or background.

morphology_note.en: ori ("rise, begin") + -gin (noun) → the point of rising, where something begins.
morphology_note.zh: ori（升起、开始）+ -gin（名词后缀）→ 升起的地方，即起源。

definition.en: Present or existing from the beginning; not a copy; inventive and creative.

morphology_note.en: ori ("begin") + -ginal (adj.) → from the beginning, first of its kind.
morphology_note.zh: ori（开始）+ -ginal（形容词后缀）→ 从一开始的，即原始的。

definition.en: To have one's origin in a place or situation; to create or initiate.

morphology_note.en: ori ("begin") + -ginate (verb) → to bring into being, to start.
morphology_note.zh: ori（开始）+ -ginate（动词后缀）→ 使产生，即发起。

definition.en: To align or position relative to a direction; the East.

morphology_note.en: ori ("rise") + -ent (adj./noun) → where the sun rises, the East; to face the rising sun, to find direction.
morphology_note.zh: ori（升起）+ -ent（后缀）→ 太阳升起的地方，即东方；面向太阳确定方向。

definition.en: The process of adjusting to new surroundings; the direction something faces; a person's basic attitudes or beliefs.

morphology_note.en: ori ("rise, direction") + -entation (noun) → the act of finding direction, adjustment.
morphology_note.zh: ori（升起、方向）+ -entation（名词后缀）→ 确定方向的行为，即定向。

definition.en: To cause someone to lose their sense of direction; to confuse.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("not, away") + ori ("rise, direction") + -ent → to lose direction.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（不、离开）+ ori（方向）+ -ent → 失去方向，即使迷失。

definition.en: Inhabiting a land from the earliest times; indigenous.

morphology_note.en: ab- ("from") + ori ("origin") + -ginal (adj.) → from the origin, existing from the beginning.
morphology_note.zh: ab-（从）+ ori（起源）+ -ginal（形容词后缀）→ 从起源就存在的，即土著的。

definition.en: To terminate prematurely; to end a pregnancy; to call off an operation.

morphology_note.en: ab- ("away from") + ort (variant of ori, "rise, be born") → to prevent from rising, to fail to come to fruition.
morphology_note.zh: ab-（偏离）+ ort（ori 的变体，升起、诞生）→ 阻止诞生，即中止。

definition.en: The quality of being novel or new; the ability to think creatively.

morphology_note.en: original + -ity (noun) → the quality of being original.
morphology_note.zh: original（原创的）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 原创的品质。

definition.en: A set of two things used together; to join or match.

morphology_note.en: pair (from par, "equal") → two equal things together.
morphology_note.zh: pair（源自 par，相等的）→ 两个相等的东西，即一对。

definition.en: To examine the similarities and differences between two or more things.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + par ("equal") + -e → to put together as equals, to examine side by side.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ par（相等）+ -e → 放在一起对等看待，即比较。

definition.en: The act of examining similarities and differences; a likeness.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + par ("equal") + -ison (noun) → the act of setting as equals, comparing.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ par（相等）+ -ison（名词后缀）→ 并列对等的行为，即比较。

definition.en: Able to be compared; of equivalent quality or standard.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + par ("equal") + -able (adj.) → able to be set as equals.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ par（相等）+ -able（可…的）→ 可以并列对等的。

definition.en: A great difference; inequality.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("not") + par ("equal") + -ity (noun) → not equal, a state of inequality.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（不）+ par（相等）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 不相等的状态，即差异。

definition.en: To weaken or damage, especially a function or ability.

morphology_note.en: im- (variant of in-, "making") + pair (from par, "worse") → to make worse, to damage.
morphology_note.zh: im-（使…）+ pair（源自 par，变差）→ 使变差，即损害。

definition.en: To restore to good condition; the act of fixing something.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again, back") + pair (from par, "prepare, restore") → to make ready again, to fix.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ pair（源自 par，准备、恢复）→ 再次准备好，即修理。

definition.en: Impossible to repair or rectify.
definition.zh: 不可修复的；无法弥补的

morphology_note.en: ir- ("not") + re- ("again") + par ("prepare") + -able (adj.) → not able to be prepared again, beyond fixing.
morphology_note.zh: ir-（不）+ re-（再次）+ par（准备）+ -able（可…的）→ 无法再修复的。

definition.en: A person of the same age, status, or ability; to look closely.

morphology_note.en: peer (from par, "equal") → one who is equal, a person of the same rank.
morphology_note.zh: peer（源自 par，相等的）→ 平等的人，即同辈。

definition.en: Having no equal; unrivaled; an unmatched person or thing.

morphology_note.en: non- ("not") + par ("equal") + -eil → without equal, unmatched.
morphology_note.zh: non-（不）+ par（相等）+ -eil → 无人可比的。

definition.en: A piece or segment of something; to divide or separate.

morphology_note.en: part ("divide, share") → a divided piece, a portion.
morphology_note.zh: part（分割、分享）→ 被分出的一块，即部分。

definition.en: Existing only in part; incomplete; biased in favor of one side.

morphology_note.en: part ("divide") + -ial (adj.) → of a part, not complete.
morphology_note.zh: part（分割）+ -ial（形容词后缀）→ 属于部分的，即不完整的。

definition.en: Treating all rivals or disputants equally; fair and unbiased.

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + part ("side") + -ial (adj.) → not taking a side, unbiased.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ part（一方）+ -ial（形容词后缀）→ 不偏向任何一方的。

definition.en: To take part in an activity or event.

morphology_note.en: part ("share") + -icipate (verb, "take") → to take a share, to join in.
morphology_note.zh: part（分享）+ -icipate（拿取）→ 拿到一份，即参与。

definition.en: A person who shares in an activity or business; a spouse or companion.

morphology_note.en: part ("share") + -ner (agent) → one who shares, a co-participant.
morphology_note.zh: part（分享）+ -ner（施动者后缀）→ 共享者，即伙伴。

definition.en: To leave, especially in order to start a journey.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away") + part ("divide, separate") → to separate away, to leave.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开）+ part（分离）→ 分离开去，即出发。

definition.en: A division of a large organization; a section of a store or government.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away") + part ("divide") + -ment (noun) → a divided section, a separate division.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开）+ part（分割）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 被划分出的部分，即部门。

definition.en: Separated by a distance; into pieces.

morphology_note.en: a- ("to") + part ("divide") → to the side, separated.
morphology_note.zh: a-（向）+ part（分割）→ 分到一旁，即分开的。

definition.en: A person or thing that corresponds to another; an equivalent.

morphology_note.en: counter- ("corresponding") + part ("piece") → a corresponding piece, an equivalent.
morphology_note.zh: counter-（相对的）+ part（部分）→ 对应的部分，即对等之人或物。

definition.en: Used to single out one member of a group; especially great or intense; fastidious.

morphology_note.en: part ("piece") + -icular (adj., "small piece") → relating to a single small part, hence specific.
morphology_note.zh: part（部分）+ -icular（小部分的）→ 与单个小部分相关的，即特定的。

definition.en: A part or share of a whole; the comparative relationship between things.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("for, according to") + port (variant of part, "share") + -ion (noun) → a share according to measure, a balanced relationship.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（按照）+ port（part 的变体，份额）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 按比例的份额。

definition.en: To make information known; to give a quality to something.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in, into") + part ("share") → to share into, to bestow.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ part（分享）→ 分享给，即传授。

definition.en: Able to wait without becoming annoyed; a person receiving medical treatment.

morphology_note.en: pat (variant of path, "suffer, endure") + -ient (adj.) → one who endures, hence tolerant or one who suffers illness.
morphology_note.zh: pat（path 的变体，承受）+ -ient（后缀）→ 能承受的人，即耐心的或病人。

definition.en: The capacity to accept delay or trouble without getting angry.

morphology_note.en: pat ("suffer, endure") + -ience (noun) → the quality of enduring, forbearance.
morphology_note.zh: pat（承受）+ -ience（名词后缀）→ 承受的品质，即耐心。

definition.en: A strong and barely controllable emotion; intense enthusiasm for something.

morphology_note.en: pass (variant of path, "suffer, feel") + -ion (noun) → intense feeling, strong emotion.
morphology_note.zh: pass（path 的变体，感受）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 强烈的感受，即激情。

definition.en: Showing or caused by strong feelings or beliefs.

morphology_note.en: passion + -ate (adj.) → full of passion, intensely emotional.
morphology_note.zh: passion（激情）+ -ate（形容词后缀）→ 充满激情的。

definition.en: Sympathetic concern for the sufferings of others.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together, with") + pass ("suffer") + -ion (noun) → to suffer with another, fellow-feeling.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pass（承受）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 与他人一起承受痛苦，即同情。

definition.en: Feelings of pity and sorrow for someone else's misfortune; understanding between people.

morphology_note.en: sym- ("together, with") + path ("feel, suffer") + -y (noun) → feeling together with, shared emotion.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（一起）+ path（感受）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 一起感受，即同情。

definition.en: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.

morphology_note.en: em- ("in") + path ("feel") + -y (noun) → feeling into, understanding another's feelings.
morphology_note.zh: em-（进入）+ path（感受）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 深入感受，即共情。

definition.en: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.

morphology_note.en: a- ("without") + path ("feeling") + -y (noun) → without feeling, indifference.
morphology_note.zh: a-（没有）+ path（感受）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 没有感受，即冷漠。

definition.en: A deep-seated feeling of dislike or aversion.

morphology_note.en: anti- ("against") + path ("feeling") + -y (noun) → feeling against, strong dislike.
morphology_note.zh: anti-（对抗）+ path（感受）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 对抗的感受，即反感。

definition.en: Arousing pity; miserably inadequate.

morphology_note.en: path ("feeling, suffering") + -etic (adj.) → causing feeling, arousing pity.
morphology_note.zh: path（感受、痛苦）+ -etic（形容词后缀）→ 引发情感的，即可悲的。

definition.en: Able to exist or work together without conflict.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + pat ("suffer, endure") + -ible (adj.) → able to suffer or exist together, harmonious.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pat（承受）+ -ible（可…的）→ 能一起共处的，即兼容的。

definition.en: A person suffering from a personality disorder marked by antisocial behavior and lack of empathy.

morphology_note.en: psycho- ("mind, soul") + path ("suffering, disease") → one whose mind suffers, a person with a mental disorder.
morphology_note.zh: psycho-（心灵）+ path（疾病）→ 心灵有疾病的人，即精神病患者。

definition.en: A lever pressed by the foot to operate a mechanism; to work the pedals of a bicycle.

morphology_note.en: ped ("foot") + -al (adj./noun) → relating to the foot, a foot-operated lever.
morphology_note.zh: ped（脚）+ -al（后缀）→ 与脚相关的，即踏板。

definition.en: A person walking rather than traveling by car or other vehicle; dull and uninspired.

morphology_note.en: ped ("foot") + -estrian (noun) → one who goes on foot, a walker.
morphology_note.zh: ped（脚）+ -estrian（名词后缀）→ 用脚走路的人，即行人。

definition.en: A base or support on which a statue or column is mounted; a position of great respect.

morphology_note.en: ped ("foot") + -estal (noun) → the foot of a structure, a base.
morphology_note.zh: ped（脚）+ -estal（名词后缀）→ 结构的脚，即底座。

definition.en: An animal that walks on two feet.

morphology_note.en: bi- ("two") + ped ("foot") → having two feet.
morphology_note.zh: bi-（二）+ ped（脚）→ 有两只脚的，即两足动物。

definition.en: To make an action or process happen sooner or more quickly.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + ped ("foot") + -ite (verb) → to free the feet, to remove obstacles and speed up.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ ped（脚）+ -ite（动词后缀）→ 解放双脚，即加速。

definition.en: A journey undertaken for a specific purpose, especially exploration.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + ped ("foot") + -ition (noun) → a going out on foot, a journey.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ ped（脚）+ -ition（名词后缀）→ 出发远行，即远征。

definition.en: Convenient and practical, though possibly improper or immoral; a means of attaining an end.
definition.zh: 权宜的；方便的；应急手段

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + ped ("foot") + -ient (adj.) → freeing the feet, hence advantageous and quick.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ ped（脚）+ -ient（形容词后缀）→ 解放双脚的，即方便快捷的。

definition.en: To delay or prevent by obstructing; to hinder.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in, on") + ped ("foot") + -e → to shackle the feet, to obstruct.
morphology_note.zh: im-（在…上）+ ped（脚）+ -e → 束缚双脚，即阻碍。

definition.en: A hindrance or obstruction; a defect in speech.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in") + ped ("foot") + -iment (noun) → that which shackles the feet, an obstacle.
morphology_note.zh: im-（在…上）+ ped（脚）+ -iment（名词后缀）→ 束缚双脚的东西，即障碍。

definition.en: A cosmetic treatment of the feet and toenails.

morphology_note.en: ped ("foot") + -i- + cure ("care") → care of the feet.
morphology_note.zh: ped（脚）+ -i- + cure（护理）→ 脚的护理，即修脚。

definition.en: A person who is among the first to explore or develop something new.

morphology_note.en: pion (from ped, "foot" — a foot soldier) + -eer (agent) → originally a foot soldier who cleared the way, hence a trailblazer.
morphology_note.zh: pion（源自 ped，脚——步兵）+ -eer（施动者后缀）→ 原为开路的步兵，即先驱。

definition.en: To drive or urge someone to do something; to force forward.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in, into") + pel ("drive, push") → to drive into, to urge forward.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ pel（驱动）→ 驱使前进，即推动。

definition.en: A sudden strong urge to act; a driving force; a pulse of energy.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in") + puls (variant of pel, "drive") + -e → a drive from within, a sudden urge.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ puls（pel 的变体，驱动）+ -e → 内在的驱力，即冲动。

definition.en: To force out or dismiss from a place, organization, or school.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + pel ("drive") → to drive out, to force to leave.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ pel（驱动）→ 驱赶出去，即驱逐。

definition.en: To drive or push forward.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + pel ("drive") → to drive forward.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ pel（驱动）→ 向前驱动，即推进。

definition.en: The action of driving or pushing forward; a force that propels.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + puls ("drive") + -ion (noun) → the act of driving forward.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ puls（驱动）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 向前驱动的行为，即推进。

definition.en: To force or oblige someone to do something.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together, intensifier") + pel ("drive") → to drive together, to force.
morphology_note.zh: com-（加强语气）+ pel（驱动）→ 强力驱使，即强迫。

definition.en: Evoking interest or attention in an irresistible way; convincing.
definition.zh: 引人注目的；令人信服的

morphology_note.en: com- ("intensifier") + pel ("drive") + -ling (adj.) → that which drives forcefully, irresistibly engaging.
morphology_note.zh: com-（加强语气）+ pel（驱动）+ -ling（形容词后缀）→ 强力吸引的。

definition.en: Required by law or rule; obligatory.

morphology_note.en: com- ("intensifier") + puls ("drive") + -ory (adj.) → driven by force, mandatory.
morphology_note.zh: com-（加强语气）+ puls（驱动）+ -ory（形容词后缀）→ 被强制驱动的，即义务的。

definition.en: To drive back or away; to cause disgust in.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + pel ("drive") → to drive back.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ pel（驱动）→ 驱赶回去，即击退。

definition.en: To make a doubt, feeling, or belief disappear.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + pel ("drive") → to drive apart, to scatter.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分散）+ pel（驱动）→ 驱散。

definition.en: A serious or urgent request; attractiveness; to make a request to a higher court.

morphology_note.en: ap- (variant of ad-, "to") + peal (variant of pel, "drive") → to drive toward, to direct a plea to.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（ad- 的变体，向）+ peal（pel 的变体，驱动）→ 驱向，即呼吁。

definition.en: To expand and contract rhythmically; to throb.

morphology_note.en: puls (variant of pel, "push, drive") + -ate (verb) → to push rhythmically, to throb.
morphology_note.zh: puls（pel 的变体，推动）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 有节奏地推动，即搏动。

definition.en: Practical contact with and observation of facts or events; to encounter or undergo.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out of, through") + peri ("try, attempt") + -ence (noun) → knowledge gained by trying, practical wisdom.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（通过）+ peri（尝试）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 通过尝试获得的知识，即经验。

definition.en: A scientific procedure to test a hypothesis; to try out new ideas.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out, through") + peri ("try") + -ment (noun) → the act of trying out, a test.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（通过）+ peri（尝试）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 尝试的行为，即实验。

definition.en: Based on untested ideas; relating to scientific experiments.

morphology_note.en: experiment + -al (adj.) → relating to experiments or testing.
morphology_note.zh: experiment（实验）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 与实验相关的。

definition.en: A person with extensive knowledge or skill in a particular area; highly skilled.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out of, thoroughly") + per ("try") + -t → one who has thoroughly tried, hence highly skilled.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（完全地）+ per（尝试）+ -t → 彻底尝试过的人，即专家。

definition.en: Expert skill or knowledge in a particular field.

morphology_note.en: expert + -ise (noun) → the skill of an expert.
morphology_note.zh: expert（专家）+ -ise（名词后缀）→ 专家的技能，即专长。

definition.en: Serious and immediate danger; a risk or threat.

morphology_note.en: peri ("try, risk") + -l → a trial or test, hence danger.
morphology_note.zh: peri（尝试、冒险）+ -l → 考验，即危险。

definition.en: To put at risk of being harmed or destroyed; to endanger.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in, into") + peril ("danger") → to put into danger.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ peril（危险）→ 使陷入危险，即危及。

definition.en: A person who attacks and robs ships at sea; to reproduce something without authorization.

morphology_note.en: pir (variant of peri, "try, attack") + -ate (noun) → one who attempts or attacks, a sea raider.
morphology_note.zh: pir（peri 的变体，尝试、攻击）+ -ate（名词后缀）→ 进行攻击的人，即海盗。

definition.en: Having knowledge or skill gained from doing something over a period of time.

morphology_note.en: experience + -ed (adj.) → having gained knowledge through trying.
morphology_note.zh: experience（经验）+ -ed（形容词后缀）→ 通过尝试获得了知识的。

definition.en: A human being regarded as an individual.

morphology_note.en: person (from Latin persona, "mask, character") → an individual human being.
morphology_note.zh: person（源自拉丁语 persona，面具、角色）→ 一个独立的人。

definition.en: Belonging to or affecting a particular person; of or concerning one's private life.

morphology_note.en: person + -al (adj.) → relating to a person, private.
morphology_note.zh: person（人）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 与个人相关的，即私人的。

definition.en: The combination of characteristics or qualities that form a person's distinctive character.

morphology_note.en: personal + -ity (noun) → the quality of being a person, distinctive character.
morphology_note.zh: personal（个人的）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 个人的特质，即个性。

definition.en: People employed in an organization or engaged in a service; the department managing employees.

morphology_note.en: person + -nel (collective noun) → the body of persons in an organization.
morphology_note.zh: person（人）+ -nel（集合名词后缀）→ 组织中的全体人员。

definition.en: Not influenced by personal feelings; lacking warmth or personality.
definition.zh: 非个人的；冷淡的；没有人情味的

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + person + -al (adj.) → not personal, lacking individual character.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ person（人）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 非个人的，即冷淡的。

definition.en: Relating to relationships or communication between people.

morphology_note.en: inter- ("between") + person + -al (adj.) → between persons, relating to interaction.
morphology_note.zh: inter-（在…之间）+ person（人）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 在人与人之间的。

definition.en: To design or produce something to meet someone's individual requirements.

morphology_note.en: personal + -ize (verb) → to make personal, to customize.
morphology_note.zh: personal（个人的）+ -ize（动词后缀）→ 使个人化，即定制。

definition.en: To represent a quality or concept as a person; to be the embodiment of.

morphology_note.en: person + -ify (verb, "make") → to make into a person, to give human qualities to.
morphology_note.zh: person（人）+ -ify（使…化）→ 使成为人，即拟人化。

definition.en: The attribution of human characteristics to something non-human; a perfect example of a quality.

morphology_note.en: personify + -ation (noun) → the act of making into a person, a human representation.
morphology_note.zh: personify（拟人化）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 拟人化的行为。

definition.en: To strive to gain or win something by defeating others.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + pet ("seek, strive") + -e → to seek together, to vie with one another.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pet（追求）+ -e → 一起追求，即竞争。

definition.en: The activity of competing; a contest; rival businesses collectively.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + pet ("seek") + -ition (noun) → the act of seeking together, a contest.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pet（追求）+ -ition（名词后缀）→ 一起追求的行为，即竞争。

definition.en: Relating to competition; having a strong desire to win; as good as or better than others.
definition.zh: 竞争的；有竞争力的；好胜的

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + pet ("seek") + -itive (adj.) → tending to seek against others, rivalry-oriented.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pet（追求）+ -itive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于与他人竞争的。

definition.en: Having the necessary ability, knowledge, or skill to do something successfully.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + pet ("seek, be fit") + -ent (adj.) → fitting together, adequate for the task.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ pet（追求、适合）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 合适的，即胜任的。

definition.en: Never ending or changing; occurring repeatedly.
definition.zh: 永久的；永恒的；连续不断的

morphology_note.en: per- ("through, completely") + pet ("seek, go toward") + -ual (adj.) → going through continuously, unceasing.
morphology_note.zh: per-（通过、完全）+ pet（追求）+ -ual（形容词后缀）→ 不断追求的，即永久的。

definition.en: To make something continue indefinitely; to preserve.

morphology_note.en: per- ("through") + pet ("seek") + -uate (verb) → to make go on continuously.
morphology_note.zh: per-（通过）+ pet（追求）+ -uate（动词后缀）→ 使持续下去。

definition.en: A natural desire to satisfy a bodily need, especially for food; a strong desire.

morphology_note.en: ap- (variant of ad-, "toward") + pet ("seek") + -ite (noun) → a seeking toward, a desire.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（ad- 的变体，向）+ pet（追求）+ -ite（名词后缀）→ 向往追求，即食欲。

definition.en: A formal written request signed by many people; to make a formal request.

morphology_note.en: pet ("seek, request") + -ition (noun) → the act of seeking, a formal request.
morphology_note.zh: pet（追求、请求）+ -ition（名词后缀）→ 请求的行为，即请愿。

definition.en: To say or do something again; an instance of repeating.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + peat (variant of pet, "seek, go to") → to seek again, to do over.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ peat（pet 的变体，追求）→ 再次追求，即重复。

definition.en: The action of repeating something; an instance of this.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + pet ("seek") + -ition (noun) → the act of seeking again, doing over.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ pet（追求）+ -ition（名词后缀）→ 再次追求的行为，即重复。

definition.en: The force that makes something happen or happen more quickly; a driving force.

morphology_note.en: im- ("toward") + pet ("seek, rush") + -us (noun) → a rushing toward, a driving force.
morphology_note.zh: im-（向）+ pet（追求）+ -us（名词后缀）→ 向前冲的力量，即推动力。

definition.en: Acting or done quickly without thought; rash.

morphology_note.en: im- ("toward") + pet ("rush, seek") + -uous (adj.) → rushing toward without thinking, rash.
morphology_note.zh: im-（向）+ pet（冲、追求）+ -uous（形容词后缀）→ 不假思索地冲向前的，即冲动的。

definition.en: A large or sufficient amount; more than enough.

morphology_note.en: ple ("fill") + -nty (noun) → the state of being filled, abundance.
morphology_note.zh: ple（充满）+ -nty（名词后缀）→ 充满的状态，即充足。

definition.en: Existing in great quantity; abundant.

morphology_note.en: plenty + -ful (adj.) → full of plenty, abundant.
morphology_note.zh: plenty（充足）+ -ful（充满…的）→ 充满丰富的，即丰富的。

definition.en: To fill up again; to restore to a former level or condition.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + ple ("fill") + -nish (verb) → to fill again.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ ple（充满）+ -nish（动词后缀）→ 再次充满，即补充。

definition.en: Having all necessary parts; to finish or make whole.

morphology_note.en: com- ("completely") + ple ("fill") + -te (adj./verb) → completely filled, having all parts.
morphology_note.zh: com-（完全地）+ ple（充满）+ -te（后缀）→ 完全充满的，即完整的。

definition.en: Not having all necessary parts; not finished.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + complete ("filled") → not completely filled, lacking parts.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ complete（完整的）→ 不完整的。

definition.en: To use up the supply or resources of; to reduce severely.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away, down") + ple ("fill") + -te → to un-fill, to empty out.
morphology_note.zh: de-（去除）+ ple（充满）+ -te → 使不再充满，即耗尽。

definition.en: To achieve or complete successfully.

morphology_note.en: ac- + com- ("completely") + pl ("fill") + -ish (verb) → to fill completely, to bring to completion.
morphology_note.zh: ac- + com-（完全地）+ pl（充满）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 完全填充，即完成。

definition.en: To act in accordance with a wish, command, or rule.

morphology_note.en: com- ("completely") + ply (variant of ple, "fill, fulfill") → to fulfill completely, to obey.
morphology_note.zh: com-（完全地）+ ply（ple 的变体，充满、实现）→ 完全实现要求，即遵守。

definition.en: To put into effect or action; a tool or instrument.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in") + ple ("fill") + -ment (noun/verb) → to fill in, to carry out; a tool that fills a need.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ ple（充满）+ -ment（后缀）→ 填充执行，即实施。

definition.en: A thing that completes or makes perfect; to add to in a way that enhances.

morphology_note.en: com- ("completely") + ple ("fill") + -ment (noun) → that which fills completely, a completing addition.
morphology_note.zh: com-（完全地）+ ple（充满）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 使完全充满的东西，即补充。

definition.en: Something added to complete or enhance; to add an extra element.

morphology_note.en: sup- (variant of sub-, "under, up") + ple ("fill") + -ment (noun) → to fill up from below, to add to.
morphology_note.zh: sup-（sub- 的变体，从下面）+ ple（充满）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 从下补充，即增补。

definition.en: An excess of something; a large or excessive amount.

morphology_note.en: pleth (variant of ple, "fill") + -ora (noun) → an overfilling, excess.
morphology_note.zh: pleth（ple 的变体，充满）+ -ora（名词后缀）→ 过度充满，即过量。

definition.en: To show approval by clapping the hands; to express strong approval.

morphology_note.en: ap- (variant of ad-, "to") + plaud (variant of plod, "clap, strike") → to clap toward, to show approval.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（ad- 的变体，向）+ plaud（plod 的变体，拍击）→ 向…拍手，即鼓掌。

definition.en: Approval shown by clapping hands; enthusiastic praise.

morphology_note.en: ap- ("to") + plaus (variant of plod, "clap") + -e → the act of clapping, approval.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（向）+ plaus（plod 的变体，拍击）+ -e → 拍手的行为，即掌声。

definition.en: An expression of praise or approval; acclaim.

morphology_note.en: plaud ("clap, approve") + -it (noun) → an act of clapping, hence praise.
morphology_note.zh: plaud（拍手、赞同）+ -it（名词后缀）→ 拍手的行为，即赞美。

definition.en: Seeming reasonable or probable; convincing.
definition.zh: 似乎合理的；看似可信的

morphology_note.en: plaus (variant of plod, "clap, approve") + -ible (adj.) → worthy of applause, hence believable.
morphology_note.zh: plaus（plod 的变体，拍手赞同）+ -ible（可…的）→ 值得赞同的，即可信的。

definition.en: Not seeming reasonable or probable; hard to believe.
definition.zh: 难以置信的；不合情理的

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + plaus ("approve") + -ible (adj.) → not worthy of approval, unbelievable.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ plaus（赞同）+ -ible（可…的）→ 不值得赞同的，即不可信的。

definition.en: To burst or shatter violently; to increase suddenly and rapidly.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + plod ("clap, drive off stage") → originally to drive an actor off stage by clapping; later, to burst outward.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ plod（拍击）→ 原为拍手将演员赶下台；后引申为向外爆裂。

definition.en: A violent shattering or blowing apart; a sudden outburst or rapid increase.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + plos (variant of plod, "burst") + -ion (noun) → a bursting outward.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ plos（plod 的变体，爆裂）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 向外爆裂，即爆炸。

definition.en: Able or likely to explode; a substance that can cause an explosion.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + plos ("burst") + -ive (adj.) → tending to burst outward.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出）+ plos（爆裂）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于爆裂的。

definition.en: To collapse violently inward; to fail suddenly and completely.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in, inward") + plod ("burst") + -e → to burst inward, the opposite of explode.
morphology_note.zh: im-（向内）+ plod（爆裂）+ -e → 向内爆裂，即内爆。

definition.en: An instance of collapsing violently inward; a sudden failure or collapse.

morphology_note.en: im- ("inward") + plos ("burst") + -ion (noun) → a bursting inward.
morphology_note.zh: im-（向内）+ plos（爆裂）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 向内爆裂，即内爆。

definition.en: Easy to carry or move around.

morphology_note.en: port ("carry") + -able ("capable of") → capable of being carried.
morphology_note.zh: port（搬运）+ -able（可…的）→ 可搬运的，即便携的。

definition.en: To carry people or goods from one place to another; the system for doing this.

morphology_note.en: trans- ("across") + port ("carry") → to carry across.
morphology_note.zh: trans-（跨越）+ port（搬运）→ 跨越搬运，即运输。

definition.en: To bring goods or services into a country from abroad; something imported.

morphology_note.en: im- ("into") + port ("carry") → to carry into a country.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ port（搬运）→ 搬运进来，即进口。

definition.en: To send goods or services to another country for sale; something exported.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + port ("carry") → to carry out of a country.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出去）+ port（搬运）→ 搬运出去，即出口。

definition.en: To hold up or give assistance to someone or something.

morphology_note.en: sup- ("from below") + port ("carry") → to carry from below, i.e. to hold up.
morphology_note.zh: sup-（从下方）+ port（搬运）→ 从下方承载，即支撑、支持。

definition.en: To expel a foreigner from a country, typically for legal reasons.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away") + port ("carry") → to carry away from a place.
morphology_note.zh: de-（离开）+ port（搬运）→ 搬离某地，即驱逐出境。

definition.en: A favorable time or set of circumstances for doing something.

morphology_note.en: ob- ("toward") + port ("harbor, carry") + -unity → favorable winds carrying one toward harbor.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（朝向）+ port（港口/搬运）+ -unity → 顺风驶入港口，引申为机会。

definition.en: A place where aircraft regularly take off and land, with buildings for passengers.

morphology_note.en: air + port ("harbor, gateway") → a harbor for air travel.
morphology_note.zh: air（空中）+ port（港口）→ 空中的港口，即机场。

definition.en: To give an account of something; a spoken or written description of an event.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + port ("carry") → to carry back information.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ port（搬运）→ 将信息带回，即报告。

definition.en: Of great significance or value.

morphology_note.en: im- ("in") + port ("carry") + -ant (adj.) → carrying weight in a matter.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ port（搬运）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 有分量的，即重要的。

definition.en: An activity involving physical exertion and skill, often competitive.

morphology_note.en: Shortened from "disport" — dis- ("away") + port ("carry") → to carry oneself away from work, i.e. to play.
morphology_note.zh: 缩写自 disport — dis-（离开）+ port（搬运）→ 把自己从工作中搬走，即娱乐、运动。

definition.en: To push firmly; the act of pressing; newspapers and journalists collectively.

morphology_note.en: press ("push, squeeze") → the basic root meaning to push or apply force.
morphology_note.zh: press（推、挤压）→ 词根本义为施压。

definition.en: The force exerted on a surface; the feeling of stress or urgency.

morphology_note.en: press ("push") + -ure (noun) → the state of pushing or being pushed.
morphology_note.zh: press（推压）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 推压的状态，即压力。

definition.en: To make someone feel admiration and respect.
definition.zh: 给…留下深刻印象；使钦佩

morphology_note.en: im- ("into") + press ("push") → to push an image into someone's mind.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ press（压）→ 将印象压入内心，即打动。

definition.en: Evoking admiration through size, quality, or skill.
definition.zh: 令人印象深刻的；给人深刻印象的

morphology_note.en: im- ("into") + press ("push") + -ive (adj.) → tending to push into one's mind.
morphology_note.zh: im-（进入）+ press（压）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 能压入内心的，即令人印象深刻的。

definition.en: To convey a thought or feeling in words or actions; fast or direct.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + press ("push") → to push out thoughts or feelings.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ press（压）→ 将想法挤压出来，即表达。

definition.en: The act of making feelings or thoughts known; a look on someone's face.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + press ("push") + -ion (noun) → the act of pushing out.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ press（压）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 向外推出的行为，即表达。

definition.en: To make someone feel sad; to push down or reduce.

morphology_note.en: de- ("down") + press ("push") → to push down emotionally or physically.
morphology_note.zh: de-（向下）+ press（压）→ 向下压，即使沮丧、使萧条。

definition.en: To press or squeeze together; to make something smaller.

morphology_note.en: com- ("together") + press ("push") → to push together into a smaller space.
morphology_note.zh: com-（一起）+ press（压）→ 挤压到一起，即压缩。

definition.en: To keep someone in hardship or subjection by the unjust use of authority.

morphology_note.en: op- ("against") + press ("push") → to push against someone, i.e. to tyrannize.
morphology_note.zh: op-（对着）+ press（压）→ 对人施压，即压迫。

definition.en: To forcibly put an end to; to prevent from being expressed.

morphology_note.en: sup- ("under, down") + press ("push") → to push down and keep hidden.
morphology_note.zh: sup-（在下面）+ press（压）→ 向下压住，即镇压、抑制。

definition.en: To restrain or hold back feelings or actions.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + press ("push") → to push back and restrain.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ press（压）→ 向后压住，即压抑、克制。

definition.en: A mental condition marked by persistent sadness; an economic downturn.

morphology_note.en: de- ("down") + press ("push") + -ion (noun) → the state of being pushed down.
morphology_note.zh: de-（向下）+ press（压）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 被压下的状态，即抑郁、萧条。

definition.en: The amount of money for which something is sold or bought.

morphology_note.en: From Latin pretium ("value, reward") → pric → the value set on something.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 pretium（价值、报酬）→ pric → 某物的定价。

definition.en: So valuable that no price can be set; invaluable.

morphology_note.en: price ("value") + -less ("without") → without a price, i.e. invaluable.
morphology_note.zh: price（价格）+ -less（无…的）→ 无法定价的，即无价的。

definition.en: Of great value; highly esteemed or cherished.

morphology_note.en: preci- (from pretium, "value") + -ous (adj.) → of great value.
morphology_note.zh: preci-（源自 pretium，价值）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 有极大价值的。

definition.en: To recognize the value of; to be grateful for; to increase in value.

morphology_note.en: ap- ("to") + preci ("value") + -ate (verb) → to assign value to something.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（向）+ preci（价值）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 赋予价值，即欣赏、感激。

definition.en: To decrease in value over time.

morphology_note.en: de- ("down") + preci ("value") + -ate (verb) → to bring down the value.
morphology_note.zh: de-（向下）+ preci（价值）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 降低价值，即贬值。

definition.en: To assess the value or quality of something.

morphology_note.en: ap- ("to") + praise (variant of "price/value") → to set a value on something.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（向）+ praise（价格/价值的变体）→ 对某物定价，即评估。

definition.en: A reward given for winning or for outstanding achievement; to value highly.

morphology_note.en: From Old French pris ("price, value") → something valued, i.e. a reward.
morphology_note.zh: 源自古法语 pris（价格、价值）→ 有价值之物，即奖赏。

definition.en: To express warm approval or admiration.

morphology_note.en: From Latin pretiare ("to value") → to assign high value, i.e. to commend.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 pretiare（评价）→ 给予高评价，即赞扬。

definition.en: Gratitude; recognition of value; an increase in value.

morphology_note.en: ap- ("to") + preci ("value") + -ation (noun) → the act of valuing.
morphology_note.zh: ap-（向）+ preci（价值）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 赋予价值的行为。

definition.en: To impose a penalty on someone for an offense.

morphology_note.en: pun ("penalty") + -ish (verb) → to inflict a penalty.
morphology_note.zh: pun（惩罚）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 施加惩罚。

definition.en: The act of punishing or the penalty imposed.

morphology_note.en: punish + -ment (noun) → the result or act of punishing.
morphology_note.zh: punish（惩罚）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 惩罚的行为或结果。

definition.en: Inflicting or intended as punishment.

morphology_note.en: pun ("penalty") + -itive (adj.) → relating to or serving as punishment.
morphology_note.zh: pun（惩罚）+ -itive（形容词后缀）→ 与惩罚相关的。

definition.en: Exemption from punishment or freedom from harmful consequences.

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + pun ("penalty") + -ity (noun) → the state of not being penalized.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ pun（惩罚）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 不受惩罚的状态。

definition.en: A punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract.

morphology_note.en: pen- (variant of pun, "penalty") + -alty (noun) → a punitive consequence.
morphology_note.zh: pen-（pun 的变体，惩罚）+ -alty（名词后缀）→ 惩罚性的后果。

definition.en: To feel deep regret for a wrongdoing and resolve to change.

morphology_note.en: re- ("intensely") + pent (from poenitere, related to pun "penalty") → to feel intense inner penalty.
morphology_note.zh: re-（加强）+ pent（源自 poenitere，与 pun 惩罚相关）→ 内心感到强烈惩罚，即忏悔。

definition.en: Physical suffering or discomfort; mental distress.

morphology_note.en: From Latin poena ("penalty, punishment") → suffering as a consequence.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 poena（惩罚）→ 作为后果的痛苦。

definition.en: Causing physical or emotional pain.

morphology_note.en: pain ("suffering") + -ful ("full of") → full of suffering.
morphology_note.zh: pain（痛苦）+ -ful（充满…的）→ 充满痛苦的。

definition.en: To impose a penalty on someone for a rule violation.

morphology_note.en: pen- (variant of pun, "penalty") + -al + -ize (verb) → to make subject to a penalty.
morphology_note.zh: pen-（pun 的变体，惩罚）+ -al + -ize（动词后缀）→ 使受到惩罚。

definition.en: Done with or employing great care and thoroughness.
definition.zh: 煞费苦心的；极其仔细的

morphology_note.en: pains ("effort, trouble") + taking → taking great pains, i.e. extremely careful.
morphology_note.zh: pains（辛苦、努力）+ taking（承受）→ 承受巨大辛苦，即极为细致的。

definition.en: To make someone aware of or familiar with something.

morphology_note.en: ac- ("to") + quaint ("know") → to cause to know.
morphology_note.zh: ac-（向）+ quaint（知道）→ 使之知道，即使熟悉。

definition.en: A person one knows slightly; knowledge or experience of something.

morphology_note.en: ac- ("to") + quaint ("know") + -ance (noun) → the state of knowing someone.
morphology_note.zh: ac-（向）+ quaint（知道）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 认识某人的状态。

definition.en: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.

morphology_note.en: From Latin cognitus ("known") → something well-crafted and notable, hence charmingly unusual.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 cognitus（已知的）→ 精巧而引人注目的，引申为古雅的。

definition.en: To move in a circle around an axis or center.

morphology_note.en: rot ("wheel, turn") + -ate (verb) → to turn in a circle.
morphology_note.zh: rot（轮、转）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 做圆周运动，即旋转。

definition.en: The action of rotating; a regular cycle of changes.

morphology_note.en: rot ("turn") + -ation (noun) → the act of turning.
morphology_note.zh: rot（转）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 转动的行为，即旋转、轮换。

definition.en: Relating to or involving rotation; a traffic circle.

morphology_note.en: rot ("turn") + -ary (adj.) → relating to turning.
morphology_note.zh: rot（转）+ -ary（形容词后缀）→ 与转动有关的。

definition.en: Mechanical or habitual repetition as a way of learning.

morphology_note.en: From rot ("wheel, routine") → learning by repetitive cycling, like a wheel.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 rot（轮、循环）→ 像轮子一样反复循环的学习，即死记硬背。

definition.en: Offensively impolite or bad-mannered; rough or primitive.

morphology_note.en: From Latin rudis ("rough, raw, unworked") → lacking refinement.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 rudis（粗糙的、未加工的）→ 缺乏教养的。

definition.en: Willfully causing pain or suffering; merciless.

morphology_note.en: From Latin crudus ("raw, rough"), related to rudis → raw and unfeeling, hence merciless.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 crudus（生的、粗糙的），与 rudis 相关 → 生硬无情的，即残忍。

definition.en: Not cooked; in its natural state; unprocessed.

morphology_note.en: Cognate with Latin rudis ("rough") via Grimm's Law → in its natural, unprocessed state.
morphology_note.zh: 通过格林法则与拉丁语 rudis（粗糙的）同源 → 处于自然未加工状态。

definition.en: Relating to the countryside rather than the town.

morphology_note.en: From Latin rus ("countryside, open land"), related to rudis ("rough") → pertaining to the open countryside.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 rus（乡村、旷野），与 rudis（粗糙的）相关 → 与乡村有关的。

definition.en: The most basic elements or principles of a subject.

morphology_note.en: rud ("raw, rough") + -iment (noun) → the raw beginning stage of knowledge.
morphology_note.zh: rud（粗糙的、原始的）+ -iment（名词后缀）→ 知识的原始阶段，即基础。

definition.en: Involving or limited to basic principles; undeveloped.
definition.zh: 基本的；初步的；未发展的

morphology_note.en: rudiment ("basic element") + -ary (adj.) → relating to the basics.
morphology_note.zh: rudiment（基础）+ -ary（形容词后缀）→ 与基础有关的。

definition.en: Having or showing great knowledge or learning.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out of") + rud ("raw, rough") + -ite (adj.) → polished out of roughness, i.e. well-educated.
morphology_note.zh: e-（从…出来）+ rud（粗糙的）+ -ite（形容词后缀）→ 从粗糙中磨练出来的，即博学的。

definition.en: Relating to the countryside; simple and charming in style.
definition.zh: 乡村的；质朴的；田园风格的

morphology_note.en: From Latin rusticus ("of the country"), related to rudis ("rough") → having country-style simplicity.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 rusticus（乡村的），与 rudis（粗糙的）相关 → 具有乡村式的质朴。

definition.en: To meet the expectations, needs, or desires of someone.

morphology_note.en: sat ("enough") + -fy ("make") → to make enough, i.e. to fulfill.
morphology_note.zh: sat（足够）+ -fy（使…）→ 使足够，即满足。

definition.en: The fulfillment of one's wishes or expectations; a feeling of contentment.

morphology_note.en: sat ("enough") + fac ("make") + -tion (noun) → the state of being made content.
morphology_note.zh: sat（足够）+ fac（做）+ -tion（名词后缀）→ 被满足的状态。

definition.en: Fulfilling expectations or needs; acceptable but not outstanding.

morphology_note.en: satisfy + -ory (adj.) → tending to satisfy.
morphology_note.zh: satisfy（满足）+ -ory（形容词后缀）→ 能令人满意的。

definition.en: To soak thoroughly; to fill completely with something.

morphology_note.en: satur- (from sat, "enough, full") + -ate (verb) → to fill to capacity.
morphology_note.zh: satur-（源自 sat，足够、充满）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 充满到极限。

definition.en: Impossible to satisfy; always wanting more.
definition.zh: 贪得无厌的；无法满足的

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + sati ("enough") + -able ("capable") → not capable of having enough.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ sati（足够）+ -able（可…的）→ 不可能满足的。

definition.en: To satisfy fully; to provide more than enough.

morphology_note.en: sati ("enough") + -ate (verb) → to make fully enough.
morphology_note.zh: sati（足够）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使完全满足。

definition.en: Not content or happy with something.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("not") + satisfied → not made content.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（不）+ satisfied（满意的）→ 不满意的。

definition.en: A useful or valuable thing or person; property owned by a person or company.

morphology_note.en: From Latin ad satis ("to sufficiency") → enough property to settle debts, hence valuable possessions.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 ad satis（到足够）→ 足以偿债的财产，即资产。

definition.en: The use of humor, irony, or exaggeration to expose and criticize.

morphology_note.en: From Latin satura ("medley, full dish") → a full mixture of criticism, i.e. satirical commentary.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 satura（大杂烩、满盘）→ 充满批评的混合体，即讽刺。

definition.en: An object orbiting a planet; an artificial body placed in orbit.

morphology_note.en: From Latin satelles ("attendant, guard") → one who accompanies, like a moon orbiting a planet.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 satelles（随从、护卫）→ 陪伴者，如围绕行星运行的卫星。

definition.en: To perform duties or provide a service for someone.

morphology_note.en: serv ("to serve, to keep") → to attend to or work for.
morphology_note.zh: serv（服务、保持）→ 侍候或为之工作。

definition.en: The action of helping or doing work for someone; a system supplying a public need.

morphology_note.en: serv ("serve") + -ice (noun) → the act or system of serving.
morphology_note.zh: serv（服务）+ -ice（名词后缀）→ 服务的行为或体系。

definition.en: To be worthy of reward, punishment, or a particular treatment.

morphology_note.en: de- ("completely") + serv ("serve") → to serve completely, hence to be entitled to.
morphology_note.zh: de-（完全地）+ serv（服务）→ 完全尽责地服务，故值得回报。

definition.en: To keep something for future use; a supply set aside.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + serv ("keep") → to keep back for later use.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ serv（保存）→ 留存备用，即预订、储备。

definition.en: To maintain something in its existing state; to keep safe from harm.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + serv ("keep") → to keep safe beforehand.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（预先）+ serv（保存）→ 提前保管好，即保存、保护。

definition.en: To protect from harm or waste; to use carefully.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together, thoroughly") + serv ("keep") → to keep thoroughly, i.e. to protect.
morphology_note.zh: con-（共同、彻底地）+ serv（保存）→ 彻底保存，即保护、节约。

definition.en: The protection and careful management of natural resources or cultural heritage.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + serv ("keep") + -ation (noun) → the act of keeping together and protecting.
morphology_note.zh: con-（共同）+ serv（保存）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 共同保存的行为，即保护。

definition.en: To watch carefully; to notice; to follow a custom or rule.

morphology_note.en: ob- ("toward, over") + serv ("watch, keep") → to watch over carefully.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（朝向）+ serv（看守、保持）→ 仔细看守，即观察。

definition.en: The act of watching or noticing something; a remark based on what one has seen.

morphology_note.en: ob- ("toward") + serv ("watch") + -ation (noun) → the act of watching toward something.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（朝向）+ serv（看守）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 朝向某物注视的行为。

definition.en: Favoring traditional views and values; averse to change.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + serv ("keep") + -ative (adj.) → tending to keep things as they are.
morphology_note.zh: con-（共同）+ serv（保存）+ -ative（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于保持现状的。

definition.en: A person who performs duties for others, especially in a household.

morphology_note.en: serv ("serve") + -ant ("one who") → one who serves.
morphology_note.zh: serv（服务）+ -ant（…的人）→ 服务的人。

definition.en: A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + serv ("keep") + -oir (place) → a place that keeps water stored.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回）+ serv（保存）+ -oir（场所后缀）→ 存储水的场所，即水库。

definition.en: Resembling without being identical.

morphology_note.en: simil (from sim, "same, like") + -ar (adj.) → being like something else.
morphology_note.zh: simil（源自 sim，相同、相似）+ -ar（形容词后缀）→ 与其他事物相像的。

definition.en: Easily understood or done; not complicated.

morphology_note.en: sim ("one, same") + -ple (from plicare, "fold") → having one fold, i.e. uncomplicated.
morphology_note.zh: sim（一、相同）+ -ple（源自 plicare，折叠）→ 只有一层折叠的，即简单的。

definition.en: To make something simpler or easier to do or understand.

morphology_note.en: simple + -fy ("make") → to make simple.
morphology_note.zh: simple（简单的）+ -fy（使…）→ 使变简单。

definition.en: To imitate the appearance or character of something.

morphology_note.en: simul (from sim, "same, like") + -ate (verb) → to make something seem the same.
morphology_note.zh: simul（源自 sim，相同）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使看起来相同，即模拟。

definition.en: Occurring or existing at the same time.

morphology_note.en: simul ("at the same time") + -taneous (adj.) → happening at the same time.
morphology_note.zh: simul（同时）+ -taneous（形容词后缀）→ 在同一时间发生的。

definition.en: To absorb and integrate into a wider society or culture; to take in knowledge.

morphology_note.en: as- ("to") + simil ("same") + -ate (verb) → to make the same, i.e. to absorb into.
morphology_note.zh: as-（向）+ simil（相同）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使变得相同，即同化。

definition.en: To look or seem like something else.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again, intensifier") + semble (from sim, "same, like") → to be like.
morphology_note.zh: re-（加强语气）+ semble（源自 sim，相似）→ 相像。

definition.en: To come together in a group; to fit parts together.

morphology_note.en: as- ("to, together") + semble (from sim, "same") → to bring to the same place.
morphology_note.zh: as-（向、一起）+ semble（源自 sim，相同）→ 带到同一处，即集合、组装。

definition.en: An elaborate musical composition for a full orchestra.

morphology_note.en: sym- (from sim, "together") + phon ("sound") + -y (noun) → sounds together in harmony.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（源自 sim，共同）+ phon（声音）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 声音和谐地在一起。

definition.en: A mark, sign, or word that represents an idea or object.

morphology_note.en: sym- (from sim, "together") + bol ("throw") → things thrown together to represent a concept.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（源自 sim，共同）+ bol（投掷）→ 放在一起代表某个概念的东西。

definition.en: The quality of being made up of exactly similar parts facing each other.

morphology_note.en: sym- (from sim, "together, same") + metr ("measure") + -y (noun) → the same measure on both sides.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（源自 sim，共同、相同）+ metr（测量）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 两边测量相同。

definition.en: A word having the same or nearly the same meaning as another.

morphology_note.en: syn- (from sim, "same, together") + onym ("name") → the same name, i.e. a word with the same meaning.
morphology_note.zh: syn-（源自 sim，相同）+ onym（名字）→ 相同的名字，即同义词。

definition.en: A physical or mental sign of a disease or condition.

morphology_note.en: sym- (from sim, "together") + ptom ("fall") → something that falls together with a disease.
morphology_note.zh: sym-（源自 sim，共同）+ ptom（降临）→ 与疾病一起出现的东西，即症状。

definition.en: A place where something is located or takes place.

morphology_note.en: From Latin situs ("position, place") → sit ("to settle") → a place where something sits.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 situs（位置）→ sit（坐落）→ 某物坐落的地方。

definition.en: A set of circumstances in which one finds oneself; a state of affairs.

morphology_note.en: situ ("place, position") + -ation (noun) → the state of how things are placed.
morphology_note.zh: situ（位置）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 事物所处的状态，即形势。

definition.en: To think carefully about something before making a decision.

morphology_note.en: con- ("with, together") + sider (from sidus "star", related to sit "observe") → to observe the stars together, i.e. to think carefully.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ sider（源自 sidus 星辰，与 sit 观察相关）→ 一起观察星象，引申为仔细考虑。

definition.en: The elected head of a republic; the head of an organization.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + sid ("sit") + -ent ("one who") → one who sits before others, i.e. presides.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在前面）+ sid（坐）+ -ent（…的人）→ 坐在前面的人，即主持者、总统。

definition.en: A person who lives somewhere permanently or on a long-term basis.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, again") + sid ("sit") + -ent ("one who") → one who sits back and stays, i.e. an inhabitant.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ sid（坐）+ -ent（…的人）→ 坐回来安居的人，即居民。

definition.en: To become less intense, violent, or severe; to sink to a lower level.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("under, down") + sid ("sit") → to sit down, i.e. to settle or diminish.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（向下）+ sid（坐）→ 坐下去，即沉降、消退。

definition.en: To have or own something; to dominate someone's thoughts.

morphology_note.en: pos- (from potis, "powerful") + sess ("sit") → to sit upon something as master, i.e. to own.
morphology_note.zh: pos-（有力的）+ sess（坐）→ 以主人身份坐在某物上，即拥有。

definition.en: To preoccupy or fill the mind continually and disturbingly.
definition.zh: 使着迷；使困扰；念念不忘

morphology_note.en: ob- ("before, upon") + sess ("sit") → to sit upon one's mind, i.e. to haunt thoughts.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（在…上面）+ sess（坐）→ 盘踞在心头，即困扰、着迷。

definition.en: To evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or quality of something.

morphology_note.en: as- ("to, beside") + sess ("sit") → to sit beside a judge, i.e. to evaluate.
morphology_note.zh: as-（在旁边）+ sess（坐）→ 坐在法官旁边，引申为评估。

definition.en: Matter that settles to the bottom of a liquid.

morphology_note.en: sed ("sit, settle") + -iment (noun) → material that settles and sits at the bottom.
morphology_note.zh: sed（坐、沉降）+ -iment（名词后缀）→ 沉降到底部的物质。

definition.en: Involving much sitting and little physical activity.

morphology_note.en: sed ("sit") + -entary (adj.) → characterized by sitting.
morphology_note.zh: sed（坐）+ -entary（形容词后缀）→ 以坐着为特征的。

definition.en: To take the place of something previously in authority or use.

morphology_note.en: super- ("above") + sede ("sit") → to sit above, i.e. to replace.
morphology_note.zh: super-（在上方）+ sede（坐）→ 坐在上面，即取代。

definition.en: A person who opposes official policy; holding opposing views.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + sid ("sit") + -ent ("one who") → one who sits apart, i.e. disagrees.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ sid（坐）+ -ent（…的人）→ 坐在一旁的人，即持不同意见者。

definition.en: A performance or undertaking done by one person alone.

morphology_note.en: sol ("alone") + -o → done alone.
morphology_note.zh: sol（独自）+ -o → 独自完成的。

definition.en: Done or existing alone; without companions.

morphology_note.en: sol ("alone") + -itary (adj.) → being alone.
morphology_note.zh: sol（独自）+ -itary（形容词后缀）→ 独自一人的。

definition.en: The state of being alone, especially in a peaceful way.

morphology_note.en: sol ("alone") + -itude (noun, state) → the state of being alone.
morphology_note.zh: sol（独自）+ -itude（名词后缀，状态）→ 独自的状态。

definition.en: One and only; the bottom of a shoe or foot.

morphology_note.en: sol ("alone, single") → one and only.
morphology_note.zh: sol（独自的、唯一的）→ 仅此一个的。

definition.en: To set apart from others; to place alone.

morphology_note.en: From Italian isola ("island"), from Latin insula, related to sol ("alone") → to make into an island, i.e. to separate.
morphology_note.zh: 源自意大利语 isola（岛屿），与 sol（孤独）相关 → 使成为孤岛，即隔离。

definition.en: Empty and bleak; feeling wretched and lonely.

morphology_note.en: de- ("completely") + sol ("alone") + -ate → made completely alone, i.e. forsaken.
morphology_note.zh: de-（完全地）+ sol（孤独）+ -ate → 完全孤独的，即荒凉的。

definition.en: Firm and stable; not liquid or hollow.

morphology_note.en: From Latin solidus ("whole, firm") → undivided and firm.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 solidus（完整的、坚固的）→ 不可分的、坚固的。

definition.en: To combine or unite into a single more effective whole; to strengthen.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + solid ("firm") + -ate (verb) → to make firm together.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ solid（坚固）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 使一起变坚固，即巩固。

definition.en: Relating to or determined by the sun.

morphology_note.en: sol (from Latin sol, "sun") + -ar (adj.) → relating to the sun.
morphology_note.zh: sol（源自拉丁语 sol，太阳）+ -ar（形容词后缀）→ 与太阳有关的。

definition.en: Formal and dignified; serious and sincere.

morphology_note.en: From Latin sollemnis ("yearly, established, formal") → performed with ritual seriousness.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 sollemnis（每年的、正式的）→ 以仪式般的严肃态度进行的。

definition.en: No longer produced or used; out of date.

morphology_note.en: ob- ("away") + sol (from solere, "be accustomed") + -ete → grown away from custom, i.e. no longer used.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（离开）+ sol（源自 solere，习惯于）+ -ete → 脱离了习惯，即不再使用的。

definition.en: To find an answer to a problem or mystery.

morphology_note.en: solv ("loosen, release") → to loosen the knot of a problem.
morphology_note.zh: solv（松开、释放）→ 松开问题的结，即解决。

definition.en: A means of solving a problem; a liquid mixture.

morphology_note.en: sol (from solv, "loosen") + -ution (noun) → the act of loosening a problem.
morphology_note.zh: sol（源自 solv，松开）+ -ution（名词后缀）→ 松开问题的过程，即解决方案。

definition.en: To settle or find a solution to; firm determination.

morphology_note.en: re- ("intensely, again") + solv ("loosen") → to loosen thoroughly, i.e. to settle firmly.
morphology_note.zh: re-（加强）+ solv（松开）→ 彻底松开，引申为下定决心、解决。

definition.en: A firm decision; the solving of a problem; clarity of an image.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again, intensely") + sol ("loosen") + -ution (noun) → a thorough loosening, i.e. a firm decision or solution.
morphology_note.zh: re-（加强）+ sol（松开）+ -ution（名词后缀）→ 彻底的解开，即决议或解决。

definition.en: To become incorporated into a liquid; to bring to an end.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + solv ("loosen") → to loosen apart into pieces.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分散）+ solv（松开）→ 松散分开，即溶解。

definition.en: To declare someone free from blame, guilt, or responsibility.

morphology_note.en: ab- ("from") + solv ("loosen") → to loosen from guilt.
morphology_note.zh: ab-（从…中）+ solv（松开）→ 从罪责中松开，即赦免。

definition.en: Complete and total; not qualified or diminished.
definition.zh: 绝对的；完全的；不受限制的

morphology_note.en: ab- ("from") + solut (from solv, "loosen") → loosened from all restrictions, i.e. total.
morphology_note.zh: ab-（从…中）+ solut（源自 solv，松开）→ 从一切限制中松开，即绝对的。

definition.en: Admirably purposeful, determined, and unwavering.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again, intensely") + solut ("loosened") → having loosened all doubt, i.e. firmly decided.
morphology_note.zh: re-（加强）+ solut（松开）→ 解开所有疑虑的，即坚定的。

definition.en: A liquid able to dissolve other substances; having enough money to pay debts.

morphology_note.en: solv ("loosen") + -ent (noun/adj.) → something that loosens or dissolves.
morphology_note.zh: solv（松开）+ -ent（名词/形容词后缀）→ 能松开、溶解他物的东西。

definition.en: Unable to pay debts owed; bankrupt.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + solv ("loosen, pay") + -ent (adj.) → not able to loosen (release) debts.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ solv（松开、偿付）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 无法偿付的。

definition.en: Relating to or using sound waves.

morphology_note.en: son ("sound") + -ic (adj.) → relating to sound.
morphology_note.zh: son（声音）+ -ic（形容词后缀）→ 与声音有关的。

definition.en: A system for detecting objects underwater using sound waves.

morphology_note.en: Acronym from "SOund NAvigation and Ranging" — son ("sound") at its core.
morphology_note.zh: 缩写自 "SOund NAvigation and Ranging"（声音导航与测距）— 核心是 son（声音）。

definition.en: Exceeding the speed of sound.

morphology_note.en: super- ("above, beyond") + son ("sound") + -ic (adj.) → beyond the speed of sound.
morphology_note.zh: super-（超越）+ son（声音）+ -ic（形容词后缀）→ 超越声速的。

definition.en: To produce or be filled with a deep, full sound; to evoke a strong response.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, again") + son ("sound") + -ate (verb) → to sound back again, i.e. to echo.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ son（声音）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 声音回响，即共鸣。

definition.en: A lack of harmony; a combination of sounds that clash.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + son ("sound") + -ance (noun) → sounds that are apart, i.e. clashing.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分离）+ son（声音）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 声音不一致的状态，即不和谐。

definition.en: A speech sound that is not a vowel; in agreement or harmony with.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + son ("sound") + -ant → sounding together with vowels.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ son（声音）+ -ant → 与元音一起发声的。

definition.en: Imposingly deep and full in sound.

morphology_note.en: son ("sound") + -orous (adj.) → full of sound.
morphology_note.zh: son（声音）+ -orous（形容词后缀）→ 充满声音的，即洪亮的。

definition.en: Of or involving sound waves with a frequency above the upper limit of human hearing.

morphology_note.en: ultra- ("beyond") + son ("sound") + -ic (adj.) → beyond audible sound.
morphology_note.zh: ultra-（超越）+ son（声音）+ -ic（形容词后缀）→ 超越可听声音的。

definition.en: Better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual.

morphology_note.en: spec ("look, kind") + -ial (adj.) → of a particular kind, i.e. distinctive.
morphology_note.zh: spec（看、种类）+ -ial（形容词后缀）→ 属于特定种类的，即特别的。

definition.en: A group of living organisms with shared characteristics that can interbreed.

morphology_note.en: spec ("look, appearance") + -ies → things that look alike, i.e. a kind or type.
morphology_note.zh: spec（外观、看）+ -ies → 看起来相似的一类，即物种。

definition.en: Clearly defined or identified; particular.

morphology_note.en: spec ("look, kind") + -ific ("making") → making something look particular.
morphology_note.zh: spec（看、种类）+ -ific（使成为）→ 使其看起来特定的。

definition.en: A feeling of deep admiration; to regard with esteem.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, again") + spect ("look") → to look back at, i.e. to regard with admiration.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回头）+ spect（看）→ 回头看，即尊重、敬仰。

definition.en: To regard something as likely to happen.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + pect (from spec, "look") → to look out for something.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ pect（源自 spec，看）→ 向外张望，即期待。

definition.en: To look at something closely in order to assess its condition or quality.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + spect ("look") → to look into closely.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ spect（看）→ 深入地看，即检查。

definition.en: A particular attitude or way of regarding something; a point of view.

morphology_note.en: per- ("through") + spect ("look") + -ive (noun/adj.) → the way one looks through things.
morphology_note.zh: per-（穿过）+ spect（看）+ -ive（名词/形容词后缀）→ 透过事物看的方式，即视角。

definition.en: To believe something is likely or possible; a person believed to be guilty.

morphology_note.en: su- (from sub, "under, secretly") + spect ("look") → to look at secretly, i.e. to distrust.
morphology_note.zh: su-（源自 sub，暗中）+ spect（看）→ 暗中察看，即怀疑。

definition.en: A visually striking performance or display; (pl.) eyeglasses.

morphology_note.en: spect ("look") + -acle (noun) → something worth looking at.
morphology_note.zh: spect（看）+ -acle（名词后缀）→ 值得一看的东西，即景象。

definition.en: A band of colors produced by light; a wide range.

morphology_note.en: spect ("look, see") + -rum (noun) → something seen or observed, originally the band of light colors.
morphology_note.zh: spect（看）+ -rum（名词后缀）→ 所见之物，最初指光的色带。

definition.en: The possibility of a future event; a potential customer or candidate.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + spect ("look") → to look forward, i.e. what lies ahead.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ spect（看）→ 向前看，即前景、展望。

definition.en: A survey or review of past events.

morphology_note.en: retro- ("backward") + spect ("look") → to look backward at the past.
morphology_note.zh: retro-（向后）+ spect（看）→ 向后看，即回顾。

definition.en: The forming of theories without firm evidence; investment in risky ventures.

morphology_note.en: spec ("look") + -ulation (noun) → the act of looking ahead without certainty.
morphology_note.zh: spec（看）+ -ulation（名词后缀）→ 不确定地向前看的行为，即推测。

definition.en: To feel contempt or a deep dislike for someone or something.

morphology_note.en: de- ("down") + spise (from spec, "look") → to look down upon.
morphology_note.zh: de-（向下）+ spise（源自 spec，看）→ 向下看，即鄙视。

definition.en: The non-physical part of a person; enthusiasm and energy.

morphology_note.en: spir ("breathe") + -it (noun) → that which breathes, i.e. the soul or life force.
morphology_note.zh: spir（呼吸）+ -it（名词后缀）→ 能呼吸之物，即灵魂、精神。

definition.en: To fill someone with the urge or ability to do something creative or extraordinary.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + spir ("breathe") → to breathe life or ideas into someone.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ spir（呼吸）→ 将生命或想法注入某人体内，即激励。

definition.en: The process of being mentally stimulated to do something creative; a sudden brilliant idea.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + spir ("breathe") + -ation (noun) → the act of breathing in ideas.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ spir（呼吸）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 吸入思想的行为，即灵感。

definition.en: To come to the end of a period of validity; to die.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + pir (from spir, "breathe") → to breathe out, i.e. to end.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ pir（源自 spir，呼吸）→ 呼出最后一口气，即到期、死亡。

definition.en: To make secret plans jointly to commit an unlawful act.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + spir ("breathe") → to breathe together, i.e. to whisper together in secret.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ spir（呼吸）→ 一起呼吸/耳语，即密谋。

definition.en: A secret plan by a group to do something unlawful or harmful.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + spir ("breathe") + -acy (noun) → the act of breathing together in secret.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ spir（呼吸）+ -acy（名词后缀）→ 秘密地一起呼吸的行为。

definition.en: To direct one's hopes or ambitions toward achieving something.

morphology_note.en: a- ("toward") + spir ("breathe") → to breathe toward a goal.
morphology_note.zh: a-（朝向）+ spir（呼吸）→ 朝着目标呼吸，即渴望、追求。

definition.en: To breathe; to carry out respiration.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again, repeatedly") + spir ("breathe") → to breathe repeatedly.
morphology_note.zh: re-（反复）+ spir（呼吸）→ 反复呼吸。

definition.en: To give out sweat through the pores of the skin.

morphology_note.en: per- ("through") + spir ("breathe") → to breathe through the skin, i.e. to sweat.
morphology_note.zh: per-（穿过）+ spir（呼吸）→ 通过皮肤呼吸，即出汗。

definition.en: To occur or happen; to become known.

morphology_note.en: trans- ("across, through") + pir (from spir, "breathe") → to breathe through, i.e. to come to light.
morphology_note.zh: trans-（穿过）+ pir（源自 spir，呼吸）→ 穿透呼出，引申为发生、透露。

definition.en: Relating to the human spirit or soul, as opposed to material things.

morphology_note.en: spirit ("breath, soul") + -ual (adj.) → relating to the soul.
morphology_note.zh: spirit（呼吸、灵魂）+ -ual（形容词后缀）→ 与灵魂有关的。

definition.en: The condition of something; a nation or territory; to express in words.

morphology_note.en: st ("stand") + -ate → that which stands, i.e. a condition or political entity.
morphology_note.zh: st（立、站）+ -ate → 站立之物，即状态或政治实体。

definition.en: A place where trains or buses stop; a place for a specified activity.

morphology_note.en: st ("stand") + -ation (noun) → a place where one stands or stops.
morphology_note.zh: st（立、站）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 站立/停留的地方。

definition.en: The relative social, professional, or legal position of someone.

morphology_note.en: st ("stand") + -atus → the standing or position one holds.
morphology_note.zh: st（立、站）+ -atus → 所处的位置，即地位、状态。

definition.en: Not likely to change or fail; firmly established.

morphology_note.en: st ("stand") + -able ("able to") → able to stand firm.
morphology_note.zh: st（立、站）+ -able（能…的）→ 能站稳的，即稳定的。

definition.en: To set up on a firm or permanent basis; to found.

morphology_note.en: e- (intensive) + stabl (from st, "stand") + -ish (verb) → to make stand firmly.
morphology_note.zh: e-（加强）+ stabl（源自 st，立）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 使牢固地站立，即建立。

definition.en: Occurring continuously; unchanged over time.
definition.zh: 持续不断的；恒定的；常数

morphology_note.en: con- ("together, firmly") + st ("stand") + -ant (adj.) → standing firm together, i.e. unchanging.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起、牢固地）+ st（立）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 牢固地站立，即恒定的。

definition.en: A very short period of time; happening immediately.

morphology_note.en: in- ("upon") + st ("stand") + -ant → standing upon the moment, i.e. immediate.
morphology_note.zh: in-（在…上）+ st（立）+ -ant → 站在当下，即即刻的。

definition.en: A particular kind of matter; the real or essential meaning.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("under") + st ("stand") + -ance (noun) → that which stands under, i.e. the underlying matter.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（在下面）+ st（立）+ -ance（名词后缀）→ 站在下面的东西，即实质。

definition.en: A person or thing acting in place of another; to use instead.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("under, in place of") + stit (from st, "stand") + -ute → to stand in place of another.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（在下面、代替）+ stit（源自 st，立）+ -ute → 站在另一者的位置上，即替代。

definition.en: To be a part of a whole; to establish or set up formally.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + stit (from st, "stand") + -ute → to stand together as a whole.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ stit（源自 st，立）+ -ute → 一起站立成为整体，即构成。

definition.en: An organization for a special purpose; to set up or establish.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, upon") + stit (from st, "stand") + -ute → to set up standing.
morphology_note.zh: in-（在…上）+ stit（源自 st，立）+ -ute → 使之站立起来，即创立。

definition.en: To have objective reality or being; to live.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out, forth") + ist (from st, "stand") → to stand forth, i.e. to be present.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ ist（源自 st，立）→ 向外站出来，即存在。

definition.en: To withstand the action or effect of; to refuse to accept.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, against") + sist (from st, "stand") → to stand against.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后、反对）+ sist（源自 st，立）→ 站起来反对，即抵抗。

definition.en: To help someone do something.

morphology_note.en: as- ("to, beside") + sist (from st, "stand") → to stand beside someone, i.e. to help.
morphology_note.zh: as-（在旁边）+ sist（源自 st，立）→ 站在某人身边，即帮助。

definition.en: Acting or done in the same way over time; compatible.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + sist ("stand") + -ent (adj.) → standing together, i.e. holding together over time.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ sist（立）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 一同站立，即始终一致的。

definition.en: Recognizably different; clear and unmistakable.

morphology_note.en: di- ("apart") + stinct ("prick, mark") → marked apart, i.e. clearly different.
morphology_note.zh: di-（分开）+ stinct（刺、标记）→ 被分别标记的，即不同的。

definition.en: A difference or contrast between similar things; excellence or eminence.

morphology_note.en: di- ("apart") + stinct ("mark") + -ion (noun) → the act of marking apart.
morphology_note.zh: di-（分开）+ stinct（标记）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 分别标记的行为，即区别。

definition.en: To recognize or treat as different; to be an identifying mark of.

morphology_note.en: di- ("apart") + stingu (from stinct, "prick, mark") + -ish (verb) → to mark apart.
morphology_note.zh: di-（分开）+ stingu（源自 stinct，标记）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 分别标记，即区分。

definition.en: An innate pattern of behavior; a natural tendency or intuition.

morphology_note.en: in- ("inward") + stinct ("prick, urge") → an inward pricking, i.e. a natural urge.
morphology_note.zh: in-（向内）+ stinct（刺激）→ 内在的刺激，即本能。

definition.en: Having no living members; no longer existing.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + stinct ("quench, prick out") → pricked out, i.e. extinguished.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ stinct（熄灭）→ 被熄灭的，即灭绝的。

definition.en: To put out a fire; to cause something to cease.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + stingu (from stinct, "quench") + -ish (verb) → to quench out.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ stingu（源自 stinct，熄灭）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 使熄灭。

definition.en: To encourage or arouse interest or activity.

morphology_note.en: stimul (from stinct, "prick, goad") + -ate (verb) → to prick or goad into action.
morphology_note.zh: stimul（源自 stinct，刺、驱策）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 刺激使行动。

definition.en: A mark of disgrace associated with a particular quality or person.

morphology_note.en: From Greek stigma ("mark made by a pointed instrument"), related to stinct ("prick") → a branding mark.
morphology_note.zh: 源自希腊语 stigma（尖器留下的印记），与 stinct（刺）相关 → 烙印。

definition.en: To bring about or initiate an action or event, often negatively.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in, on") + stig (from stinct, "prick, goad") + -ate (verb) → to goad into action.
morphology_note.zh: in-（在…上）+ stig（源自 stinct，刺激）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 刺激使行动，即煽动。

definition.en: Characteristic of one person or thing and distinguishing it from others.

morphology_note.en: distinct ("marked apart") + -ive (adj.) → tending to mark apart, i.e. uniquely characteristic.
morphology_note.zh: distinct（区分的）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于区分的，即独特的。

definition.en: Demanding that rules be obeyed; exact and precise.

morphology_note.en: strict (from strain, "draw tight, bind") → drawn tight, i.e. rigorous.
morphology_note.zh: strict（源自 strain，拉紧、束缚）→ 拉得紧的，即严格的。

definition.en: To put a limit on; to keep under control.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + strict ("draw tight") → to draw back tightly, i.e. to limit.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ strict（拉紧）→ 向后拉紧，即限制。

definition.en: An area of a city or country defined for administrative purposes.

morphology_note.en: di- ("apart") + strict ("draw tight, bind") → an area drawn apart and bounded.
morphology_note.zh: di-（分开）+ strict（拉紧、划定）→ 被划定边界分开的区域。

definition.en: To exert force; a state of tension or pressure.

morphology_note.en: strain ("draw tight, stretch") → to pull tight or stretch beyond comfort.
morphology_note.zh: strain（拉紧、绷紧）→ 拉得过紧。

definition.en: To prevent someone from doing something; to hold back.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + strain ("draw tight") → to draw back tightly, i.e. to hold back.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ strain（拉紧）→ 向后拉紧，即约束。

definition.en: A limitation or restriction.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + strain ("draw tight") + -t (noun) → being drawn tight together, i.e. a limitation.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ strain（拉紧）+ -t（名词后缀）→ 一起拉紧的状态，即限制。

definition.en: A state of mental or emotional strain; emphasis placed on something.

morphology_note.en: From strain ("draw tight") → the state of being drawn too tight.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 strain（拉紧）→ 被拉得太紧的状态，即压力。

definition.en: Extreme anxiety, sorrow, or pain; to cause suffering to.

morphology_note.en: di- (from dis-, "apart") + stress ("strain") → strained apart, i.e. extreme suffering.
morphology_note.zh: di-（源自 dis-，分裂）+ stress（压力）→ 被撕裂般的压力，即痛苦。

definition.en: Very strict, precise, and exacting.

morphology_note.en: string (from strain, "draw tight") + -ent (adj.) → drawn very tight, i.e. strict.
morphology_note.zh: string（源自 strain，拉紧）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 拉得很紧的，即严格的。

definition.en: To make narrower by squeezing or compressing.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + strict ("draw tight") → to draw tightly together.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ strict（拉紧）→ 一起拉紧，即收缩。

definition.en: Unusual or surprising; not previously visited or encountered.

morphology_note.en: From Latin extraneus ("external"), related to strain ("draw tight") → drawn from outside, hence unfamiliar.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 extraneus（外部的），与 strain（拉紧）相关 → 从外面拉来的，即陌生的。

definition.en: The state of touching or communicating with someone.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + tact ("touch") → to touch together, i.e. to get in touch.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ tact（触碰）→ 互相触碰，即接触、联系。

definition.en: A keen sense of what to say or do to avoid giving offense.

morphology_note.en: tact ("touch, sense of touch") → having a delicate sense of how to handle people.
morphology_note.zh: tact（触觉、感觉）→ 具有敏锐的人际感知力。

definition.en: Not damaged or impaired; complete.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + tact ("touched") → not touched, i.e. undamaged.
morphology_note.zh: in-（未）+ tact（被触碰的）→ 未被触碰的，即完好无损的。

definition.en: Perceptible by touch; clear and definite.
definition.zh: 有形的；可触摸的；确实的

morphology_note.en: tang (from tact, "touch") + -ible ("able to be") → able to be touched.
morphology_note.zh: tang（源自 tact，触碰）+ -ible（可…的）→ 可以触碰的，即有形的。

definition.en: Spread from one person to another by direct or indirect contact.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + tag (from tact, "touch") + -ious (adj.) → touching together, i.e. spreading by contact.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ tag（源自 tact，触碰）+ -ious（形容词后缀）→ 通过接触传播的。

definition.en: A planned action to achieve a specific end.

morphology_note.en: From Greek taktikos ("of arranging"), related to tact ("touch, handle") → the art of handling a situation.
morphology_note.zh: 源自希腊语 taktikos（安排的），与 tact（触碰、处理）相关 → 处理局面的艺术。

definition.en: The sensation of flavor; a person's liking or preference.

morphology_note.en: From Latin taxare ("to touch, handle"), related to tact → to test by touching to the tongue.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 taxare（触碰、处理），与 tact 相关 → 用舌头触碰来检验，即品尝。

definition.en: Of or connected with the sense of touch.

morphology_note.en: tact ("touch") + -ile (adj.) → relating to touch.
morphology_note.zh: tact（触碰）+ -ile（形容词后缀）→ 与触觉有关的。

definition.en: Unable to be touched or grasped; not having physical presence.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + tang ("touch") + -ible ("able") → not able to be touched.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ tang（触碰）+ -ible（可…的）→ 不可触碰的，即无形的。

definition.en: To cause to become twisted together or involved in a complicated situation.

morphology_note.en: en- ("cause to be") + tangle (related to tact, "touch") → to cause to touch and intertwine.
morphology_note.zh: en-（使…）+ tangle（与 tact 触碰相关）→ 使互相缠绕。

definition.en: An individual feature or item; to describe something thoroughly.

morphology_note.en: de- ("completely") + tail ("cut") → to cut completely, i.e. to divide into small parts.
morphology_note.zh: de-（完全地）+ tail（切割）→ 完全切开，即分成细小部分，即细节。

definition.en: The sale of goods to the public in small quantities.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + tail ("cut") → to cut again into small pieces, i.e. to sell in small quantities.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ tail（切割）→ 再次切成小块，即零售。

definition.en: A person who makes or alters clothing; to adapt for a particular purpose.

morphology_note.en: tail ("cut") + -or ("one who") → one who cuts cloth, i.e. a garment maker.
morphology_note.zh: tail（切割）+ -or（…的人）→ 裁剪布料的人，即裁缝。

definition.en: Including many details; thorough and comprehensive.

morphology_note.en: detail ("fine points") + -ed (adj.) → having many fine points, i.e. thorough.
morphology_note.zh: detail（细节）+ -ed（形容词后缀）→ 有很多细节的，即详细的。

definition.en: The rear part of an animal; to follow and observe someone secretly.

morphology_note.en: tail ("cut") → originally the cut-off end, hence the rear part.
morphology_note.zh: tail（切割）→ 原指被切断的末端，即尾部。

definition.en: To have within; to hold or enclose.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + tain ("hold") → to hold together inside.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ tain（握持）→ 把东西握在一起，即包含。

definition.en: To keep in an existing state; to assert something is true.

morphology_note.en: main- (from manu, "hand") + tain ("hold") → to hold in hand, i.e. to keep up.
morphology_note.zh: main-（源自 manu，手）+ tain（握持）→ 握在手中，即维持。

definition.en: To get or acquire something.

morphology_note.en: ob- ("toward") + tain ("hold") → to hold toward oneself, i.e. to acquire.
morphology_note.zh: ob-（朝向）+ tain（握持）→ 向自己抓取，即获得。

definition.en: To continue to have or keep something.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + tain ("hold") → to hold back, i.e. to keep.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ tain（握持）→ 握住不放，即保留。

definition.en: To maintain or support over a long period; to endure.

morphology_note.en: sus- (from sub, "from below") + tain ("hold") → to hold up from below.
morphology_note.zh: sus-（源自 sub，从下方）+ tain（握持）→ 从下方托住，即维持、支撑。

definition.en: Able to be maintained at a certain rate or level; causing little environmental damage.

morphology_note.en: sustain ("hold up") + -able ("capable of") → capable of being held up over time.
morphology_note.zh: sustain（维持）+ -able（可…的）→ 能长期维持的。

definition.en: To succeed in achieving something.

morphology_note.en: at- (from ad, "to") + tain ("hold") → to hold on to a goal, i.e. to achieve.
morphology_note.zh: at-（源自 ad，向）+ tain（握持）→ 抓住目标，即达到、实现。

definition.en: To provide amusement; to consider an idea or suggestion.

morphology_note.en: enter- (from inter, "among") + tain ("hold") → to hold among, i.e. to engage attention.
morphology_note.zh: enter-（源自 inter，在…之间）+ tain（握持）→ 在人们之间握住注意力，即娱乐。

definition.en: To keep someone from proceeding; to hold in custody.

morphology_note.en: de- ("away, down") + tain ("hold") → to hold someone down or away.
morphology_note.zh: de-（向下、离开）+ tain（握持）→ 扣住不放，即拘留。

definition.en: To persist in an activity or process; to keep going.
