morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + tin (from tain, "hold") + -ue → to hold together without stopping.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ tin（源自 tain，握持）+ -ue → 持续握住不放，即继续。

definition.en: Holding firmly to something; persistent and determined.

morphology_note.en: ten (from tain, "hold") + -acious (adj.) → holding on tightly, i.e. persistent.
morphology_note.zh: ten（源自 tain，握持）+ -acious（形容词后缀）→ 紧紧握住的，即顽强的。

definition.en: To restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something.

morphology_note.en: abs- ("away from") + tain ("hold") → to hold oneself away from.
morphology_note.zh: abs-（远离）+ tain（握持）→ 把自己握离，即戒除、弃权。

definition.en: The act of inflicting severe pain; to cause great suffering.

morphology_note.en: tort ("twist") + -ure (noun) → the act of twisting someone in pain.
morphology_note.zh: tort（扭曲）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 扭曲某人的行为，即折磨。

definition.en: To pull or twist out of shape; to give a misleading account of.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart") + tort ("twist") → to twist apart, i.e. to deform.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ tort（扭曲）→ 向不同方向扭曲，即歪曲。

definition.en: To obtain something by force, threats, or other unfair means.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + tort ("twist") → to twist something out of someone.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（出来）+ tort（扭曲）→ 从他人身上扭出来，即勒索。

definition.en: To twist or bend out of normal shape.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together, intensely") + tort ("twist") → to twist intensely.
morphology_note.zh: con-（加强）+ tort（扭曲）→ 剧烈扭曲。

definition.en: To say something sharp or witty in response to a criticism.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + tort ("twist") → to twist back, i.e. to throw words back.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ tort（扭曲）→ 扭回去，即反驳。

definition.en: Full of twists and turns; excessively complex.

morphology_note.en: tort ("twist") + -uous (adj.) → full of twists.
morphology_note.zh: tort（扭曲）+ -uous（形容词后缀）→ 充满扭曲的。

definition.en: Severe physical or mental suffering; to cause great anguish.

morphology_note.en: tor (from tort, "twist") + -ment (noun) → the state of being twisted in agony.
morphology_note.zh: tor（源自 tort，扭曲）+ -ment（名词后缀）→ 被痛苦扭曲的状态。

definition.en: A violently rotating column of air extending from a thunderstorm.

morphology_note.en: torn (from tort, "twist, turn") + -ado → a great twisting wind.
morphology_note.zh: torn（源自 tort，扭转）+ -ado → 巨大的旋转之风。

definition.en: A person appointed to act for another in legal matters; a lawyer.

morphology_note.en: at- (from ad, "to") + torn (from tort, "turn") → one turned to for legal help.
morphology_note.zh: at-（源自 ad，向）+ torn（源自 tort，转向）→ 受托转向处理事务的人，即律师。

definition.en: A journey for pleasure visiting various places; to make such a journey.

morphology_note.en: From tort ("turn") → a turning journey that returns to its starting point.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 tort（转）→ 转一圈回到起点的旅程。

definition.en: To cause someone to come to a place or participate in something; to draw toward.

morphology_note.en: at- (from ad, "toward") + tract ("pull, drag") → to pull toward.
morphology_note.zh: at-（源自 ad，朝向）+ tract（拉、拖）→ 向自己拉，即吸引。

definition.en: A written legal agreement; to decrease in size; to enter into an agreement.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + tract ("pull, draw") → to draw together, i.e. to agree or shrink.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ tract（拉、拖）→ 拉到一起，即签约或收缩。

definition.en: To remove or take out; a substance removed from something.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out") + tract ("pull") → to pull out.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（向外）+ tract（拉）→ 拉出来，即提取。

definition.en: To prevent someone from giving full attention to something.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("apart, away") + tract ("pull") → to pull away from focus.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（分开）+ tract（拉）→ 把注意力拉开，即分心。

definition.en: Existing in thought but not having physical reality; a summary.

morphology_note.en: abs- ("away from") + tract ("pull") → pulled away from concrete reality.
morphology_note.zh: abs-（远离）+ tract（拉）→ 从具体现实中抽离的，即抽象的。

definition.en: To take away a number or amount from another.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("from under") + tract ("pull") → to pull from under, i.e. to take away.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（从下方）+ tract（拉）→ 从下方拉走，即减去。

definition.en: To draw back or withdraw a statement, accusation, or promise.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + tract ("pull") → to pull back.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ tract（拉）→ 向后拉，即收回、撤回。

definition.en: To delay or postpone action; to put off doing something.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + crastinus ("of tomorrow") → to push forward to tomorrow, i.e. to delay.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ crastinus（明天的）→ 推到明天，即拖延。

definition.en: To behave toward or deal with; to give medical care; a special pleasure.

morphology_note.en: From Latin tractare ("to handle, manage"), from tra ("pull, drag") → to handle or manage.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 tractare（处理、管理），源自 tra（拉、拖）→ 处理、对待。

definition.en: A painting, drawing, or photograph of a person.

morphology_note.en: por- (from pro, "forth") + trait (from tra, "draw") → drawn forth, i.e. a likeness drawn out.
morphology_note.zh: por-（源自 pro，向前）+ trait（源自 tra，拖拉、描绘）→ 描绘出来的，即肖像。

definition.en: A distinguishing quality or characteristic of a person.

morphology_note.en: From tra ("draw, pull") → something drawn out or outlined, i.e. a feature.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 tra（拉、描绘）→ 被勾勒出来的东西，即特征。

definition.en: A series of connected railroad cars; to teach skills through practice.

morphology_note.en: From tra ("pull, drag") → to pull along, hence a line of cars pulled, or to pull someone through learning.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 tra（拉、拖）→ 拖拉前行，引申为列车或训练（引导人学习）。

definition.en: To shake involuntarily from fear, cold, or weakness.

morphology_note.en: trem ("shake, quiver") + -ble (verb) → to shake or quiver.
morphology_note.zh: trem（震动、颤动）+ -ble（动词后缀）→ 震颤。

definition.en: An involuntary shaking movement; a slight earthquake.

morphology_note.en: trem ("shake") + -or (noun) → a shaking.
morphology_note.zh: trem（震动）+ -or（名词后缀）→ 震动。

definition.en: Very great in amount, size, or intensity; extremely good.
definition.zh: 巨大的；极大的；了不起的

morphology_note.en: trem ("shake") + -endous (adj.) → so great as to cause trembling.
morphology_note.zh: trem（震动）+ -endous（形容词后缀）→ 大到令人发抖的，即巨大的。

definition.en: Shaking or quivering slightly; timid or nervous.

morphology_note.en: trem ("shake") + -ulous (adj.) → characterized by shaking.
morphology_note.zh: trem（震动）+ -ulous（形容词后缀）→ 以颤抖为特征的。

definition.en: Fearless and adventurous.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + trepid (from trem, "tremble, fear") → not trembling, i.e. fearless.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ trepid（源自 trem，颤抖、恐惧）→ 不颤抖的，即无畏的。

definition.en: Relating to the tropics; very hot and humid.

morphology_note.en: trop ("turn") + -ical (adj.) → relating to where the sun turns back, i.e. the tropics.
morphology_note.zh: trop（转）+ -ical（形容词后缀）→ 与太阳折返之处有关的，即热带的。

definition.en: A journey; to stumble or lose one's footing.

morphology_note.en: From trop ("turn") → a turning journey, i.e. a going out and returning.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 trop（转）→ 出去再回来的旅程。

definition.en: Each of the two parallels of latitude where the sun reaches its zenith.

morphology_note.en: trop ("turn") + -ic (noun) → the line where the sun turns back.
morphology_note.zh: trop（转）+ -ic（名词后缀）→ 太阳折返的线，即回归线。

definition.en: The tendency of plants to grow toward sunlight.

morphology_note.en: helio ("sun") + trop ("turn") + -ism (noun) → the tendency to turn toward the sun.
morphology_note.zh: helio（太阳）+ trop（转向）+ -ism（名词后缀）→ 转向太阳的倾向。

definition.en: To interfere with the normal arrangement or function of something.

morphology_note.en: dis- ("thoroughly") + turb ("stir, agitate") → to thoroughly stir up, i.e. to disrupt.
morphology_note.zh: dis-（彻底地）+ turb（搅动）→ 彻底搅动，即打扰。

definition.en: Difficulty or problems; to cause distress or worry.

morphology_note.en: From turb ("stir, agitate") → a state of agitation or disorder.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 turb（搅动）→ 搅动不安的状态，即麻烦。

definition.en: Characterized by disorder, unrest, or violent agitation.

morphology_note.en: turb ("stir, agitate") + -ulent (adj.) → full of agitation.
morphology_note.zh: turb（搅动）+ -ulent（形容词后缀）→ 充满搅动的，即动荡的。

definition.en: To make someone anxious or unsettled; to cause disorder.

morphology_note.en: per- ("thoroughly") + turb ("stir") → to stir thoroughly, i.e. to upset deeply.
morphology_note.zh: per-（彻底地）+ turb（搅动）→ 彻底搅动，即深深地扰乱。

definition.en: A machine with rotating blades driven by water, steam, or gas.

morphology_note.en: turb ("spin, stir") + -ine (noun) → a spinning machine.
morphology_note.zh: turb（旋转、搅动）+ -ine（名词后缀）→ 旋转的机器。

definition.en: Unable to be upset or excited; perfectly calm.
definition.zh: 沉着的；冷静的；泰然自若的

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + per- ("thoroughly") + turb ("stir") + -able → not able to be stirred up.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ per-（彻底）+ turb（搅动）+ -able（可…的）→ 不可被搅动的，即泰然自若的。

definition.en: A state of great disturbance, confusion, or uncertainty.

morphology_note.en: Related to turb ("stir, agitate") → a state of great agitation.
morphology_note.zh: 与 turb（搅动）相关 → 极度搅动的状态，即混乱。

definition.en: An individual thing regarded as a single entity; a quantity used as a standard of measurement.

morphology_note.en: un (from uni, "one") + -it → a single entity.
morphology_note.zh: un（源自 uni，一）+ -it → 单独的个体。

definition.en: To come or bring together for a common purpose.

morphology_note.en: un (from uni, "one") + -ite (verb) → to make one.
morphology_note.zh: un（源自 uni，一）+ -ite（动词后缀）→ 使合为一体。

definition.en: The state of being united or joined as a whole.

morphology_note.en: un (from uni, "one") + -ity (noun) → the state of being one.
morphology_note.zh: un（源自 uni，一）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 成为一体的状态。

definition.en: A distinctive set of clothing; remaining the same in all cases.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + form ("shape") → of one shape, i.e. all the same.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ form（形式）→ 统一形式的。

definition.en: Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + -que → being one of a kind.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ -que → 仅此一个的，即独特的。

definition.en: Relating to or affecting the whole world; applicable to all cases.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + vers ("turn") + -al (adj.) → turned into one, i.e. all-encompassing.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ vers（转）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 转为一体的，即普遍的。

definition.en: An institution of higher education and research.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + vers ("turn") + -ity (noun) → a community turned into one body of scholars.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ vers（转）+ -ity（名词后缀）→ 学者聚为一体的社区。

definition.en: Fully in agreement; with complete consensus.
definition.zh: 一致同意的；全体一致的

morphology_note.en: un- (from uni, "one") + anim ("mind") + -ous (adj.) → of one mind.
morphology_note.zh: un-（源自 uni，一）+ anim（心灵）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 一心一意的。

definition.en: To make or become united or uniform.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + -fy ("make") → to make into one.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ -fy（使…）→ 使合为一。

definition.en: Forward movement toward a destination; development toward a better condition.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forward") + gress (from grad, "step") → to step forward.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ gress（源自 grad，步伐）→ 向前迈步，即进步。

definition.en: A person who has completed a course of study; to complete a degree.

morphology_note.en: grad ("step, degree") + -uate (verb) → to take a step up in degree.
morphology_note.zh: grad（步伐、等级）+ -uate（动词后缀）→ 提升一个等级，即毕业。

definition.en: Relating to or characteristic of a city or town.

morphology_note.en: urb ("city") + -an (adj.) → relating to a city.
morphology_note.zh: urb（城市）+ -an（形容词后缀）→ 与城市有关的。

definition.en: To make or become urban in character.

morphology_note.en: urban ("city") + -ize (verb) → to make into a city.
morphology_note.zh: urban（城市的）+ -ize（使…化）→ 使城市化。

definition.en: Suave, courteous, and refined in manner.
definition.zh: 温文尔雅的；彬彬有礼的

morphology_note.en: urb ("city") + -ane (adj.) → having city-like refinement and polish.
morphology_note.zh: urb（城市）+ -ane（形容词后缀）→ 具有城市般的优雅和教养。

definition.en: A residential area on the outskirts of a city.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("near, under") + urb ("city") → near the city, i.e. the outskirts.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（在…附近）+ urb（城市）→ 城市附近的地方，即郊区。

definition.en: Relating to or characteristic of a suburb.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("near") + urb ("city") + -an (adj.) → relating to areas near a city.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（在附近）+ urb（城市）+ -an（形容词后缀）→ 与城市附近区域有关的。

definition.en: A district outside a city, especially a prosperous area beyond the suburbs.

morphology_note.en: ex- ("out of, beyond") + urb ("city") → beyond the city.
morphology_note.zh: ex-（在…之外）+ urb（城市）→ 在城市之外的区域。

definition.en: An extended urban area formed by the merging of several towns.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + urb ("city") + -ation (noun) → cities joined together.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ urb（城市）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 连在一起的城市。

definition.en: An extended period of leisure and recreation, especially away from home.

morphology_note.en: vac ("empty, free") + -ation (noun) → a period of being free from work.
morphology_note.zh: vac（空、闲）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 从工作中解放的时期，即假期。

definition.en: Not occupied; empty; showing no interest or thought.

morphology_note.en: vac ("empty") + -ant (adj.) → being empty.
morphology_note.zh: vac（空）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 空的。

definition.en: A space entirely devoid of matter; to clean with a vacuum cleaner.
definition.zh: 真空；吸尘器；用吸尘器打扫

morphology_note.en: vacu (from vac, "empty") + -um (noun) → an empty space.
morphology_note.zh: vacu（源自 vac，空）+ -um（名词后缀）→ 空的空间，即真空。

definition.en: To remove people from a place of danger to safety.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + vacu ("empty") + -ate (verb) → to empty out a place.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vacu（空）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 清空一个地方，即疏散。

definition.en: Having excessive pride in one's appearance; producing no result.

morphology_note.en: From Latin vanus ("empty"), related to vac → empty of substance, hence futile or conceited.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 vanus（空的），与 vac 相关 → 缺乏实质的，即徒劳或虚荣。

definition.en: To disappear suddenly and completely.

morphology_note.en: van (from vac, "empty") + -ish (verb) → to become empty, i.e. to disappear.
morphology_note.zh: van（源自 vac，空）+ -ish（动词后缀）→ 变为空的，即消失。

definition.en: A completely empty space; not valid or legally binding.

morphology_note.en: From Latin vocivus ("empty"), related to vac → an empty space.
morphology_note.zh: 源自拉丁语 vocivus（空的），与 vac 相关 → 空的空间。

definition.en: To keep away from or stop oneself from doing something.

morphology_note.en: a- ("away") + void ("empty") → to make empty by staying away.
morphology_note.zh: a-（远离）+ void（空）→ 远离使之空出，即避免。

definition.en: Having or showing a lack of thought or intelligence.

morphology_note.en: vacu (from vac, "empty") + -ous (adj.) → empty of thought.
morphology_note.zh: vacu（源自 vac，空）+ -ous（形容词后缀）→ 思想空洞的。

definition.en: To enter a country or territory with armed forces; to intrude upon.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + vad ("go, walk") → to go into, i.e. to enter by force.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ vad（走）→ 走进去，即入侵。

definition.en: To escape from or avoid, especially by cleverness or trickery.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out, away") + vad ("go") → to go away from, i.e. to escape.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vad（走）→ 走开，即逃避。

definition.en: To spread throughout; to be present and apparent throughout.

morphology_note.en: per- ("through") + vad ("go") → to go through completely.
morphology_note.zh: per-（穿过）+ vad（走）→ 完全穿过，即弥漫。

definition.en: Spreading widely throughout an area or group of people.
definition.zh: 普遍的；弥漫的；无处不在的

morphology_note.en: per- ("through") + vas (from vad, "go") + -ive (adj.) → tending to go through everything.
morphology_note.zh: per-（穿过）+ vas（源自 vad，走）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于穿透一切的。

definition.en: Tending to spread harmfully; involving entry into the body.

morphology_note.en: in- ("into") + vas (from vad, "go") + -ive (adj.) → tending to go into.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ vas（源自 vad，走）+ -ive（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于侵入的。

definition.en: Of uncertain, indefinite, or unclear character or meaning.
definition.zh: 模糊的；含糊的；不明确的

morphology_note.en: From vag (related to vad, "wander, go") → wandering, hence not fixed or clear.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 vag（与 vad 走、游荡相关）→ 游荡不定的，即模糊的。

definition.en: Lacking restraint in spending money; exceeding what is reasonable.

morphology_note.en: extra- ("beyond") + vag (from vad, "wander") + -ant (adj.) → wandering beyond limits, i.e. excessive.
morphology_note.zh: extra-（超越）+ vag（源自 vad，游荡）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 游荡超出界限的，即奢侈的。

definition.en: To walk through water or another liquid.

morphology_note.en: Cognate with Latin vadere ("to go, walk") via Grimm's Law → to walk through water.
morphology_note.zh: 通过格林法则与拉丁语 vadere（走）同源 → 在水中行走。

definition.en: The importance, worth, or usefulness of something; to consider important.

morphology_note.en: val ("be strong, be worth") + -ue (noun) → what something is worth.
morphology_note.zh: val（强壮、值得）+ -ue（名词后缀）→ 某物的价值。

definition.en: Worth a great deal of money or very useful.
definition.zh: 有价值的；贵重的；有用的

morphology_note.en: value ("worth") + -able ("worthy of") → worthy of high regard.
morphology_note.zh: value（价值）+ -able（值得…的）→ 值得重视的。

definition.en: To form an idea of the amount, number, or value of; to assess.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + valu ("worth") + -ate (verb) → to work out the worth of something.
morphology_note.zh: e-（出来）+ valu（价值）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 算出价值，即评估。

definition.en: Having a sound basis in logic or fact; legally acceptable.
definition.zh: 有效的；合理的；有根据的

morphology_note.en: val ("strong, worthy") + -id (adj.) → strong enough to stand, i.e. sound and acceptable.
morphology_note.zh: val（强壮、有价值）+ -id（形容词后缀）→ 足够有力站得住的，即有效的。

definition.en: Widespread in a particular area or at a particular time.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before, above") + val ("be strong") + -ent (adj.) → being strong above others, i.e. widespread.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在前面）+ val（强壮）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 力量在前的，即普遍流行的。

definition.en: Possessing or showing courage and determination.

morphology_note.en: val ("be strong") + -iant (adj.) → being strong and brave.
morphology_note.zh: val（强壮）+ -iant（形容词后缀）→ 强壮勇敢的。

definition.en: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something.

morphology_note.en: ambi- ("both") + val ("be strong, have power") + -ent (adj.) → pulled strongly in both directions.
morphology_note.zh: ambi-（两个）+ val（强壮、有力）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 被两个方向用力拉扯的，即矛盾的。

definition.en: Extremely useful; priceless.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + valu ("worth") + -able → not able to be valued, i.e. beyond price.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ valu（价值）+ -able（可…的）→ 无法估量价值的，即无价的。

definition.en: A thing that happens, especially one of importance.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + vent ("come") → something that comes out, i.e. an occurrence.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vent（来）→ 冒出来的事情，即事件。

definition.en: A way in which something is usually done; a large meeting or conference.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + ven ("come") + -tion (noun) → a coming together.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ ven（来）+ -tion（名词后缀）→ 走到一起，即大会、惯例。

definition.en: To create or design something that has not existed before.

morphology_note.en: in- ("upon") + vent ("come") → to come upon something new.
morphology_note.zh: in-（到…上）+ vent（来）→ 发现新事物，即发明。

definition.en: To keep something from happening.

morphology_note.en: pre- ("before") + vent ("come") → to come before and block.
morphology_note.zh: pre-（在前面）+ vent（来）→ 提前到来阻挡，即预防。

definition.en: To come between in order to prevent or alter an outcome.

morphology_note.en: inter- ("between") + ven ("come") → to come between.
morphology_note.zh: inter-（在…之间）+ ven（来）→ 介于其间，即干预。

definition.en: An unusual and exciting experience or activity.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("toward") + vent ("come") + -ure (noun) → something that comes toward you, i.e. an exciting event.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（朝向）+ vent（来）+ -ure（名词后缀）→ 向你涌来的事物，即冒险。

definition.en: Fitting in well with a person's needs or plans; involving little trouble.

morphology_note.en: con- ("together") + ven ("come") + -ient (adj.) → coming together well, i.e. suitable.
morphology_note.zh: con-（一起）+ ven（来）+ -ient（形容词后缀）→ 合在一起恰好合适的，即方便的。

definition.en: Income, especially when of an organization and of a substantial nature.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + ven ("come") + -ue (noun) → that which comes back, i.e. returns on investment.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ ven（来）+ -ue（名词后缀）→ 回来的东西，即收入。

definition.en: To find a way around an obstacle or rule.

morphology_note.en: circum- ("around") + vent ("come") → to come around, i.e. to bypass.
morphology_note.zh: circum-（绕过）+ vent（来）→ 绕过来，即规避。

definition.en: A risky or daring undertaking; to dare to do something.

morphology_note.en: ven ("come") + -ture (noun) → a coming into the unknown.
morphology_note.zh: ven（来）+ -ture（名词后缀）→ 走进未知，即冒险。

definition.en: All existing matter and space considered as a whole.

morphology_note.en: uni ("one") + vers ("turn") → everything turned into one whole.
morphology_note.zh: uni（一）+ vers（转）→ 一切化为一体的整体。

definition.en: Showing a great deal of variety; very different.

morphology_note.en: di- ("apart") + vers ("turn") → turned in different directions, i.e. varied.
morphology_note.zh: di-（分开）+ vers（转）→ 向不同方向转的，即多样的。

definition.en: To move backward; to turn something the other way round.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + vers ("turn") → to turn back.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ vers（转）→ 转回来，即反转。

definition.en: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions.

morphology_note.en: vers ("turn") + -atile (adj.) → able to turn in many directions.
morphology_note.zh: vers（转）+ -atile（形容词后缀）→ 能向多个方向转的，即多才多艺的。

definition.en: Prolonged public disagreement or heated discussion.

morphology_note.en: contra- ("against") + vers ("turn") + -y (noun) → a turning against each other.
morphology_note.zh: contra-（对着）+ vers（转）+ -y（名词后缀）→ 相互对转，即争议。

definition.en: To change from one form, nature, or function to another.

morphology_note.en: con- ("completely") + vert ("turn") → to turn completely into something else.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ vert（转）→ 完全转变。

definition.en: A talk between two or more people.

morphology_note.en: con- ("with") + vers ("turn") + -ation (noun) → a turning of words with someone.
morphology_note.zh: con-（与…一起）+ vers（转）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 与他人轮流说话。

definition.en: A shy, reticent person who is more focused on inner thoughts.

morphology_note.en: intro- ("inward") + vert ("turn") → one turned inward.
morphology_note.zh: intro-（向内）+ vert（转）→ 向内转的人。

definition.en: An outgoing, socially confident person.

morphology_note.en: extro- ("outward") + vert ("turn") → one turned outward.
morphology_note.zh: extro-（向外）+ vert（转）→ 向外转的人。

definition.en: To describe or draw attention to a product or event in a public medium.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("toward") + vert ("turn") + -ise (verb) → to turn attention toward.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（朝向）+ vert（转）+ -ise（动词后缀）→ 将注意力转向，即宣传。

definition.en: To undermine the power or authority of an established system.

morphology_note.en: sub- ("from below") + vert ("turn") → to turn from below, i.e. to overthrow.
morphology_note.zh: sub-（从下面）+ vert（转）→ 从下面翻转，即颠覆。

definition.en: An act of defeating an enemy or opponent.

morphology_note.en: vict (from vinc, "conquer") + -ory (noun) → the act of conquering.
morphology_note.zh: vict（源自 vinc，征服）+ -ory（名词后缀）→ 征服的行为，即胜利。

definition.en: To cause someone to believe firmly in the truth of something.

morphology_note.en: con- ("completely") + vinc ("conquer") → to conquer someone's doubts completely.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ vinc（征服）→ 完全征服某人的疑虑，即说服。

definition.en: Too powerful to be defeated or overcome.

morphology_note.en: in- ("not") + vinc ("conquer") + -ible ("able") → not able to be conquered.
morphology_note.zh: in-（不）+ vinc（征服）+ -ible（可…的）→ 不可被征服的。

definition.en: To declare someone guilty of a criminal offense; a person found guilty.

morphology_note.en: con- ("completely") + vict ("conquer, overcome") → overcome by evidence, i.e. proven guilty.
morphology_note.zh: con-（完全地）+ vict（征服）→ 被证据完全征服，即被判有罪。

definition.en: To expel someone from a property, especially by legal process.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + vict ("conquer") → to conquer out, i.e. to force out.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vict（征服）→ 将其征服赶出，即驱逐。

definition.en: A person harmed, injured, or killed as a result of a crime or event.

morphology_note.en: vict (from vinc, "conquer") + -im → one who is conquered, i.e. the defeated party.
morphology_note.zh: vict（源自 vinc，征服）+ -im → 被征服的人，即受害者。

definition.en: A principal administrative division of a country; a scope of responsibility.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("before, for") + vinc ("conquer") → a territory conquered for Rome, hence an administrative region.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（为了）+ vinc（征服）→ 为罗马征服的领土，即行省。

definition.en: Having won a victory; triumphant.

morphology_note.en: victor ("winner") + -ious (adj.) → relating to winning.
morphology_note.zh: victor（胜利者）+ -ious（形容词后缀）→ 与胜利有关的。

definition.en: Able to be seen; obvious to the eye.

morphology_note.en: vis ("see") + -ible ("able to be") → able to be seen.
morphology_note.zh: vis（看）+ -ible（可…的）→ 可以被看到的。

definition.en: The ability to see; the ability to think about the future with imagination.

morphology_note.en: vis ("see") + -ion (noun) → the act or power of seeing.
morphology_note.zh: vis（看）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 看的能力或行为。

definition.en: Relating to seeing or sight.

morphology_note.en: vis ("see") + -ual (adj.) → relating to seeing.
morphology_note.zh: vis（看）+ -ual（形容词后缀）→ 与看有关的。

definition.en: To observe and direct the work of others.

morphology_note.en: super- ("over, above") + vis ("see") → to see over, i.e. to oversee.
morphology_note.zh: super-（在上方）+ vis（看）→ 从上面看，即监督。

definition.en: To offer suggestions about the best course of action.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("toward") + vis ("see") → to look toward a situation and offer guidance.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（朝向）+ vis（看）→ 审视局势并提供指导，即建议。

definition.en: To examine and improve or amend a text or plan.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + vis ("see") → to look at again, i.e. to reconsider and improve.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ vis（看）→ 再次审视，即修改。

definition.en: Information indicating whether a belief or proposition is true.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + vid (from vis, "see") + -ence (noun) → what can be seen clearly.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vid（源自 vis，看）+ -ence（名词后缀）→ 能被清楚看到的东西。

definition.en: A system for transmitting visual images and sound at a distance.

morphology_note.en: tele- ("far") + vis ("see") + -ion (noun) → seeing from afar.
morphology_note.zh: tele-（远距离）+ vis（看）+ -ion（名词后缀）→ 从远处看，即电视。

definition.en: The recording, reproducing, or broadcasting of moving visual images.

morphology_note.en: vid (from vis, "see") + -eo → "I see" in Latin, hence moving images.
morphology_note.zh: vid（源自 vis，看）+ -eo → 拉丁语"我看"，引申为视频。

definition.en: A general view or examination; to look closely at or examine.

morphology_note.en: sur- (from super, "over") + vey (from vis, "see") → to see over, i.e. to examine broadly.
morphology_note.zh: sur-（源自 super，在上方）+ vey（源自 vis，看）→ 从上面看，即全面调查。

definition.en: To imagine as a future possibility.

morphology_note.en: en- ("in") + vis ("see") + -ion → to see something in the mind.
morphology_note.zh: en-（在…中）+ vis（看）+ -ion → 在脑海中看到，即设想。

definition.en: To create and perform spontaneously without preparation.

morphology_note.en: im- ("not") + pro- ("before") + vis ("see") → not seen before, i.e. unprepared.
morphology_note.zh: im-（不）+ pro-（提前）+ vis（看）→ 事先没看过的，即即兴的。

definition.en: Producing powerful feelings or strong, clear images in the mind.

morphology_note.en: viv ("live") + -id (adj.) → full of life, i.e. strikingly alive.
morphology_note.zh: viv（活）+ -id（形容词后缀）→ 充满生命力的，即生动的。

definition.en: To continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger or hardship.

morphology_note.en: sur- ("above, beyond") + viv ("live") → to live beyond danger.
morphology_note.zh: sur-（超越）+ viv（活）→ 超越危险而存活。

definition.en: To restore to life, consciousness, or strength.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + viv ("live") → to live again.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ viv（活）→ 再次活过来。

definition.en: Absolutely necessary or important; essential.

morphology_note.en: vit (from viv, "live") + -al (adj.) → relating to life, hence essential.
morphology_note.zh: vit（源自 viv，活）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 与生命有关的，即至关重要的。

definition.en: Physical strength and good health; energy and enthusiasm.

morphology_note.en: vig (from viv, "live, be strong") + -or (noun) → the state of being alive and strong.
morphology_note.zh: vig（源自 viv，活、有力）+ -or（名词后缀）→ 充满活力的状态。

definition.en: Attractively lively and animated.

morphology_note.en: viv ("live") + -acious (adj.) → full of life.
morphology_note.zh: viv（活）+ -acious（形容词后缀）→ 充满生命力的。

definition.en: To give new life or vigor to.

morphology_note.en: re- ("again") + vital ("life") + -ize (verb) → to give life again.
morphology_note.zh: re-（再次）+ vital（生命）+ -ize（使…）→ 使再次有生命力。

definition.en: Keeping careful watch for possible danger or difficulties.

morphology_note.en: vigil (from viv, "be alive, be awake") + -ant (adj.) → being awake and alert.
morphology_note.zh: vigil（源自 viv，清醒、活着）+ -ant（形容词后缀）→ 保持清醒警觉的。

definition.en: The sound produced in a person's larynx; to express an opinion.

morphology_note.en: From voc ("call, voice") → the sound produced when calling.
morphology_note.zh: 源自 voc（呼唤、声音）→ 呼唤时发出的声音。

definition.en: Relating to the voice; expressing opinions freely.

morphology_note.en: voc ("voice, call") + -al (adj.) → relating to the voice.
morphology_note.zh: voc（声音、呼唤）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 与声音有关的。

definition.en: To publicly recommend or support; a person who supports a cause.

morphology_note.en: ad- ("toward") + voc ("call") + -ate (verb) → to call toward a cause, i.e. to support.
morphology_note.zh: ad-（朝向）+ voc（呼唤）+ -ate（动词后缀）→ 为某事业呼唤，即倡导。

definition.en: To stimulate or incite someone to a reaction, especially anger.

morphology_note.en: pro- ("forth") + vok (from voc, "call") → to call forth a reaction.
morphology_note.zh: pro-（向前）+ vok（源自 voc，呼唤）→ 唤起反应，即激怒。

definition.en: To call on for help or as an authority; to cite as relevant.

morphology_note.en: in- ("upon") + vok (from voc, "call") → to call upon.
morphology_note.zh: in-（向）+ vok（源自 voc，呼唤）→ 向…呼唤，即援引。

definition.en: To bring a feeling, memory, or image to mind.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + vok (from voc, "call") → to call out from memory.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ vok（源自 voc，呼唤）→ 从记忆中唤出。

definition.en: To officially cancel a decree, decision, or promise.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back") + vok (from voc, "call") → to call back, i.e. to withdraw.
morphology_note.zh: re-（向后）+ vok（源自 voc，呼唤）→ 收回呼唤，即撤销。

definition.en: A strong feeling of suitability for a particular career; a calling.

morphology_note.en: voc ("call") + -ation (noun) → a calling, i.e. one's life purpose.
morphology_note.zh: voc（呼唤）+ -ation（名词后缀）→ 内心的呼唤，即天职。

definition.en: Open to more than one interpretation; ambiguous.

morphology_note.en: equi- ("equal") + voc ("call, voice") + -al (adj.) → calling in equal directions, i.e. ambiguous.
morphology_note.zh: equi-（相等）+ voc（呼唤）+ -al（形容词后缀）→ 向两边同样呼唤的，即模棱两可的。

definition.en: To include as a necessary part; to cause to participate.

morphology_note.en: in- ("in") + volv ("roll, turn") → to roll into, i.e. to draw in.
morphology_note.zh: in-（进入）+ volv（滚、卷）→ 卷入，即涉及。

definition.en: To develop gradually over time; to undergo biological evolution.

morphology_note.en: e- ("out") + volv ("roll") → to unroll, i.e. to unfold over time.
morphology_note.zh: e-（向外）+ volv（滚动）→ 展开，即逐步发展。

definition.en: A forcible overthrow of a government; a dramatic and wide-reaching change.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, again") + vol ("turn, roll") + -ution (noun) → a complete turning around.
morphology_note.zh: re-（回来）+ vol（转、滚）+ -ution（名词后缀）→ 完全翻转，即革命。

definition.en: To move in a circular orbit; to turn around a central point.

morphology_note.en: re- ("back, again") + volv ("roll") → to roll back repeatedly, i.e. to go in circles.
morphology_note.zh: re-（反复）+ volv（滚动）→ 反复滚动，即旋转。

definition.en: A person who freely offers to do something; to offer to do something willingly.

morphology_note.en: volunt (from vol, "will, wish") + -eer (one who) → one who acts by free will.
morphology_note.zh: volunt（源自 vol，意愿）+ -eer（…的人）→ 出于自愿行动的人。

definition.en: Done, given, or acting of one's own free will.

morphology_note.en: volunt (from vol, "will") + -ary (adj.) → of one's own will.
morphology_note.zh: volunt（源自 vol，意愿）+ -ary（形容词后缀）→ 出于自己意愿的。

definition.en: The amount of space occupied; the degree of loudness; a book forming part of a set.

morphology_note.en: vol ("roll") + -ume (noun) → a roll of parchment, hence a book; later, the space something fills.
morphology_note.zh: vol（卷）+ -ume（名词后缀）→ 一卷羊皮纸，即书卷；后引申为体积。

definition.en: Liable to change rapidly and unpredictably; easily evaporated.
definition.zh: 易变的；不稳定的；挥发性的

morphology_note.en: vol ("fly, roll") + -atile (adj.) → tending to fly off, i.e. unstable.
morphology_note.zh: vol（飞、滚）+ -atile（形容词后缀）→ 倾向于飞走的，即不稳定的。

definition.en: Well-meaning and kindly; charitable.

morphology_note.en: bene- ("well, good") + vol ("wish") + -ent (adj.) → wishing well for others.
morphology_note.zh: bene-（好的）+ vol（意愿）+ -ent（形容词后缀）→ 对他人有美好意愿的。

definition.en: Susceptible to physical or emotional harm.

morphology_note.en: vulner (from vulnus, "wound") + -able ("capable of") → capable of being wounded.
morphology_note.zh: vulner（源自 vulnus，伤口）+ -able（可…的）→ 可能被伤害的。

definition.en: A place where wild animals are kept for public display.

morphology_note.en: zo ("animal, living being") + -o → a place for animals (shortened from "zoological garden").
morphology_note.zh: zo（动物）+ -o → 动物的地方（缩写自 zoological garden）。

definition.en: The scientific study of the behavior, structure, and classification of animals.

morphology_note.en: zo ("animal") + -ology ("study of") → the study of animals.
morphology_note.zh: zo（动物）+ -ology（学科）→ 研究动物的学科。

definition.en: A scientist who studies animals.

morphology_note.en: zo ("animal") + log ("study") + -ist ("person") → a person who studies animals.
morphology_note.zh: zo（动物）+ log（研究）+ -ist（从事者）→ 研究动物的人。

definition.en: A belt of the sky divided into twelve signs, each associated with a constellation.

morphology_note.en: zo ("animal, living creature") + -diac ("circle") → a circle of animal figures in the sky.
morphology_note.zh: zo（动物）+ -diac（圆圈）→ 天空中由动物形象组成的圆圈。

definition.en: Relating to the scientific study of animals.

morphology_note.en: zo ("animal") + log ("study") + -ical (adj.) → relating to the study of animals.
morphology_note.zh: zo（动物）+ log（研究）+ -ical（形容词后缀）→ 与动物学有关的。
